Who wants an all you can eat prime rib dinner for $9.99? Me! Me! Me! Surprised to find this place at Hard Rock Casino. I thought cheap dinners like this would only be found in downtown Las Vegas.

The service was fast, the patrons who were there were eye candy- my guy friends can vouch for that, and the prime rib was soooo good. The mashed potatoes and the veggie which accompanied it was also good- but the mashed potatoes was better. I ordered my prime rib medium well and it was soft and juicy. Dipped in horseradish and au jus (sp?), it is the BOMB! I considered ordering a second plate like all of my other friends, but my clubbing dress wouldn't permit another plateful. I will definitely come back here again (with looser clothes on). And the best thing about it is that this yummy AYCE prime rib dinner is the same price of one drink at the bar.  Love it!

We just love the nostalgic feel and 'local's secret menu' of steak & shrimp for $7.77(with players card). True, you are also required to purchase a drink...But no one really needs to twist my arm to buy a drink in Vegas.  The garlic mashed potatoes and string beans are fresh and quite tasty. For me, this meal is best as a late lunch/early dinner. Its not a huge order, but it is pretty satisfying.
The staff is friendly and helpful, and the multiple times I have been here, our wait was short to none.

what can I say...everyone knows about it, the gamblers special is great...cheap, and for the price one of the best values in Vegas off strip but if you find your self there do it...well worth it. Its no Mortons or Ruth's Chis but it was good...and in the wee mornings of the hour awesome.

This place has cheap late night eats... but its just okay, nothing special. I think you can get better late night cheap eats at other places. They have a 7-7-7 special that cost $7.77 and it's a piece of steak with a shrimp skewer, mashed potatoes and salad. The salad was DRENCHED in dressing... so the point of disgusting. I could not even eat it!! Literally half the salad plate was dressing, it was like salad tossed in soup. Ask for the dressing on the side!!! I'm warning you!! The steak was cooked properly, the way I wanted it. Shrimp was nothing special and the mashed potatoes tasted like real potatoes. I'm glad I tried it, because now I can see that all the hype is just a hype. I would not go out of my way to eat here.
Good food. Had the club sandwich, they were very generous on the turkey. Also tried their vegetable soup, very tasty.

I wouldn't take my dog to Mr Luckys. Do you feel lucky punk? Well, do you?

Bad food. They can't even make a decent hamburger and fries, let alone something like a portabello burger.
Perfect diner-type food in a diner-type atmosphere! The prices are a bit high for what you're getting but they are open all day and very convenient.

Drunk food at 3am as it's the only place open at this hour - awesome taste! Though, poor service, the five, yes, five tables seated after us were served first. Perhaps they had to go out and pick the vegetables for the veggie burgers?

regular dinner take out - great service, but I can definitively say the second worst Pad Thai I've ever had. (worst was in Clayton GA if you are wondering)

Nothing Lucky about 24-7, except the hours of operation. 
ahem, the strip mall across the street also has a 24 hour place, sadly didn't realize until we were leaving.

My Vegas "have to".  For whatever reason, going back I don't know how many years my friends and I decided this was the place where we have to come to in Vegas whenever we are here.  I think it was the attraction of the $7.77 steak and shrimp that brought us here and kept bringing us back.  When we turned 21 this was the place to come and people watch from morning until the wee hours of the night.  

The food is actually good.  Had the usual steak/shrimp combo, and was not disappointed.  Steak was a little overcooked, but not overdone.  We also had the chicken nachos, which I think are fantastic.  

90% of the time we walk out and say how we are not going to order the nachos, and what happens...we order them again.  But it's worth it.  Not to pricey (even by Hard Rock standards) and you can get a seat by the walking area and people watch as you down your lunch.

I like it! It's not fine dining just simple food. It's just consistently good and that's always what brings me back! Been here on several occasions. Usually at the wee hours of the morning after a super late night or late dinner. 

I have to say that I've been happy with breakfast, lunch and dinner options. Tasty French toast! More than Delish mini pizzas. Excellent burger and fries! I'm telling you, you can't go wrong with the food here. 

I am sure the steak and eggs is next on my list to try! Hard Rock has two good places to eat.  Mr. Taco is good too!

3.5

Pretty standard as far as hotel/casino cafes go. The food was pretty good but nothing spectacular and the service was great (though a tad bit slow, given how the place wasn't very busy).

So given the fact that Mr. Lucky's sounds pretty average, you may be asking yourself the following question: what gives it the extra half star? The answer is their 6 shots for $10 deal.

I mean, what better way to start off your Vegas vacation than with a trio of Three Wise Men shots, right?

Right.

Seriously, wtf is wrong with service here? Every time I come in, seems like I have to wait a half and hour just to get water. 

Only reason for 3 star is, food'd pretty decent.

French Dip.

Since we have no family in Phoenix with us, we decided to go to Las Vegas for Thanksgiving 2016. Mr. Luckys was having a Thanksgiving buffet special for $20.99 so the four of us went there for our dinner. When we arrived, we told the hostess 3 of us wanted the buffet and we were seated. We waited for a good 15 minutes for our waitress to take our drink order and no one ever came so my husband flagged someone down and they went to get our waitress. Our waitress finally came over and told us no one had even told her she had customers, so that wasnt her fault, that was the hostess.  So we gave her our drink order and told her we wanted 3 buffets and my husband wanted to order off the menu. She brought 3 plates and vanished again. Myself and our daughters went  up to the buffet and found out it consisted of: fruit that was almost gone, green bean casserole, sweet potatoes, corn that was almost gone, steak that was cold, the turkey was down to the bone, dinner rolls that were cold, mashed potatoes were gone and all the desert was gone. We head back to our table and our drinks arent there yet. It takes another 5 minutes for someone else to bring our drinks and she never came back to even take my husbands order. We are almost done with our not-so-good dinner when my husband asks to talk to the manager. He explains that we are almost done and our waitress hasnt even taken his order yet then we ask about the buffet items and the manager explains that they are not replenishing the items any longer. We are upset because no one told us when we got there that there were few items left. The manager takes my husbands order and gives THREE of us pie, but not all of us...and takes only $3 off our bill. We eat out quite a bit and this was hands down the WOST service we have EVER had.

Located in the Hard Rock Casino, this is a cool spot to get some eats while watching the Hard Rock patrons walk through the casino.

Wait staff is always very friendly. Food is good. Price ---- good. If you are in the know, there is a special meal non--menu meal for $7.77 that is worth at least double this price. Just make sure to mention the secret code (hint, look at the price). The steak is a bit chewy, but does the job for the less fickle eater.

Recommend the American food, not as much the Chinese menu. Nachos appetizer are perfect, especially after a night out at the club! 

If it wasn't for it being located right in the heart of the Hard Rock Casino, it would be a typical diner atmosphere that could easily be called Denny's. Luckily, it's located in the Hard Rock Casino!

Rock on!

Always my favorite when your girl spends all your $ gambling. Gotta try the  777 it always does the trick. The place is nice and clean, staff is always cool. Really chill environment, vintage pictures and memorabilia of old Vegas

777 Special was good, ordered a side salad, as it doesn't come with it anymore. But steak was well done and they immediately took it back and prepared a new perfectly medium rare for me. Otherwise I would have given 5 stars. 

However, other than the specials, menu items are way overpriced such as cool looking nachos, but $12-15 for chips cheese and some meat isn't worth it.

Stick with the specials and you will enjoy your time!

Good food at the right price.   
AYCE prime rib for only $10 was crazy!  Great post-workout meal.  
Steak and eggs for only $4.99 was hearty - much better than any of the deals you'll find in Downtown Las Vegas.  

Breakfast foods are excellent.   Real blueberries accompany the blueberry pancakes.  

***Nachos are a must!  Real cheese that doesn't coagulate and stays creamy like the fake powdered cheese you get at the movies.   How do they keep it smooth?   idk, they probably add some butter to it.  Either way, tickle your inner fat bastard-ness and enjoy this.

Stopped in here late night during our stay at the Hard Rock. Got a couple sets of their shooters, which were so delicious.  Had the club sandwich to eat. You can't really go wrong with a club sandwich. Staff was nice, facility was clean. But it is all about those shooters.

The only reason it's getting 2 stars is because the food was actually good and they ended up giving us our meals for free. Went in on a Friday night, late, like 11pm late. It took over an hour for our food to come out. Most of our order was appetizers and sides, no reason for it to take over an hour. Went in the next morning despite our previous experience to get a to go order and got horrible service again. Stay away.
We tried the famous-but-off-the-menu steak and shrimp for $7.77.  It was just awful.  Avoid, avoid, avoid.

If you're in the Hard Rock late-night and hungry this is the only place going. 

I thought the menu looked really good - lots of great options here for every taste. You can also get everything to go so you can eat in your room - or anywhere else for that matter - if you prefer. 

I went for the spicy chicken sandwich because I love a good fried chicken sandwich. The chicken itself was good with a good heat to the breading. But IMO the bun was much too bread-y. Also not enough sauce for me but that's easily remedied. 

Mimosas are delicious, and they have BOGO specials!

Service is friendly and efficient.

we stumbled here specifically for the gambler's special. its steak, shrimp, scoop of mashed potatoes, all for the price of 7.77 That's pretty damn good in vegas. The longer we're elsewhere is less money the casino can rob from us! 

The steak was a good size, and we got 4 shrimps grilled. Overall it was pretty damn good. I didn't try anything else on the menu, but the 7.77 was pretty damn well worth it.

Went to play craps after with a full tummy of food. If the casino has robbed you of your money then go here for a decent meal.

PSA: do not send your teenagers or kids to pick up food for you!


I've gotten better customer service at McDonald's than here.  These people have no respect for teenagers/people who look like they didn't have tons of money.  We went downstairs to find food around 11-midnight and this place was open, of course after travelling we aren't in our expensive attire, so we go to pick up and we asked for menus, the lady was very nice and showed us, then we kinda found our way to their barstool area and waited to grab someone's attention.  We went up to one male worker and as my friend asked him a question about where to order he kinda looked at him like "why are you speaking to me?" A Very rude look.  If it wasn't for him, we probably would've spent more money! So then we get to this lady waitress and she gladly helped us, bless her.  So as we are waiting we kept getting weird looks from staff as if we were loitering when in reality we were waiting for our food so we could go to our room, eat, then sleep. 
I expected more professional attitudes at this restaurant but I guess the Yelp reviews for the hotel in general are true.  Sucks, but definitely won't be returning!

Everything I've eaten here is so good and the service has always been good too!  For early mornings, from late nights, they have a good espresso!  For breakfast, I usually stick with the eggs, bacon, hash browns, and toast. Super filling and I can never eat it all.
If you go to the hard rock casino. Try mister lucky's restaurant. Order the 777 and get a great steak and 3 shrimp , mashed potatoes and a salad.  All for 7 dollars and 77 cents .

Just the place for a bite to eat after a night of cards, dice, strippers and cocktails.  I usually go with the chicken nachos. They are gigantic and will take care of that "I'm drunk and all I want in a good amount of grease" voice in your head.  During the day you might want to go with the Ahi burger, great flavor and the fish is fresher than you might imagine.... being in the desert and all.

I found out about Mr Lucky's 24/7 located in the Hard Rock Cafe Casino through Rachel Ray's 40 Dollars A Day!  She mentioned that the "Gamblers Special" which is a New York Strip Steak, Grilled Shrimp, with Garlic Mashed Potatoes is not on the menu and that you have to ask for it and it only  cost $7.77.  This is a delicious meal and at a great price!  This is also served 24/7 too!

Amazing food, OK prices, but sometimes spotty service is the name of the game here.

I've been a bunch with my food comps and this is by far the best 24 hour casino cafe in Vegas.  The burgers are great, pancakes are some of the best I've had in my life, chicken fingers are huge and the sauces amazing (I usually prefer buffalo but their teriyaki is smoky and not overly sweet so it's great), and the steak and eggs is the best I've had -- even better than Ellis Island.  

The prices look a bit high but the portions are large and the quality is good.  I only dock a star because service can be spotty, especially when they are busy -- other times it can be above and beyond expectation

This place is miles better than Culinary Dropout right next door in every way -- value, quality, and service.

I came here first in 2009 and got their off the menu steak and shrimp. Initially, I wasn't too impressed. But, I've come back many times since then and it's been great. Most notably, the breakfast items are amazing! Everything I've ordered has been in large portions and delicious. This place is in the Hard Rock hotel next to the casino, so make sure and bring a sweatshirt or something because it's freezing in here. It's a little on the pricey side, but most things are in the larger hotels in Las Vegas. The service has been pretty good each time, regardless of how busy they are. It's open 24/7 so come by anytime to get your grub on!

Where to get a diverse yet cheap meal in a casino??? Mr Lucky's that's where. From breakfast to asian, burgers, salads to the secret menu items, this is the place to go.
I went with the $7.77 meal. Starts out with a nice sized salad loaded with croutons. Just as your finishing, your meal is on it's way to you. I nice portion of steak, mashed potatoes and 3 grilled shrimp. Perfect size meal to start your day or end your night

Coffee was barely warm. Waited 20 minutes for hot cup which was brought by a busser because our waiter was too busy discussing the best strip joints with the table next to us. 30 minutes for burger and turkey sandwich. Turkey was dry as cardboard and burger was cold. Sad because we've been here before and had great food and service .

As they say, "You get what you pay for"  The $7.77 Steak Special is just that. A small side salad, and an entree of grilled shrimp skewers, a cheap quality striploin and real mashed potatoes.

Not terribly bad, not ridiculously good...just A-OK...

Kinda reminds me of the Ellis Island Sirloin Special, smaller steak but with a grilled shrimp skewer instead of an ice cold beer...ALOHA!

Only because you can get "The Gambles Special" (off menu) for $9.99.
TIP: avoid bringing your date here and scarf down alone: this is a solo no frills filling station.

Michelle D was our server.   Very friendly and always had a smile .    $9.99 prime what a deal.   A way better deal than our $150 meal at hard rock last night at Rare.

The hot apple pie was off the hee zee.

(Overly)Overpriced and mediocre breakfast food.

SERVICE - Our server was friendly but didn't do much knowing that we weren't satisfied with our food. 

AMBIENCE - Very lively and bustling as this was one of the few (or only) places opened for breakfast inside the Hard Rock Hotel. 

FOOD - Do not order your usual basic diner food because they will be BASIC AF. Definitely ask for recommendations or read up on Yelp if it's your first time!

[STEEL CUT OATMEAL] - $9 - Bowl of sadness. DO NOT ORDER THIS. EVER. They give you TINY TINY amount of berries and walnuts (they disappear once you stir them into the oatmeal). And will charge you extra for more berries. If you must have your oatmeal go get it from McDonald's (which is way better and cheaper). 

[THE HARD ROCK BREAKFAST] - $16 - 3 eggs, 2 strips of bacon, 2 sausages, toast, and hash browns. Nothing special. NOT WORTH.

[REGULAR COFFEE] - $4 - Save it for Starbucks.

Most unsatisfying meal we had during this trip :/ Stupid expensive for really cheap/basic foods you can get anywhere.
Beat place, great price, excellent staff, great food. Second time here in less than 12 hours and I will defiantly come back again..

Not really feeling this place.  Food wasn't that great and service was lacking.  I almost went and got my own drink because the server forgot it.  My daughter's sandwich was super dry and when she opened it, she found they smeared a tiny about of mayo on about 1/3 of the bread.  Obviously they aren't overly concerned with qualify.  My pasta was pretty nasty and very greasy.

Wouldn't go back here even if it were free.

We stayed at the Hard Rock and this restaurant was unfortunately the most approachable and convenient. The first day I had the 'Rehab' breakfast, with a spinach & mushroom omelette and fresh squeezed OJ.  The omelette was barely edible, with the thick overcooked eggs (I sub'd real eggs for egg whites), and nasty unsalted spinach. The fresh squeezed OJ was excellent though.

2nd day I had the eggs over easy with hash browns and grilled ham.  The eggs were decent, but the hash browns had way too much butter (or margarine?), and the ham was well, ham, with grills marks to boot.

3rd day I had the chicken noodle soup, opting to avoid any more wasted calories at this joint.  The puny bowl came with an overly generous serving of celery, onion, and carrots, with few chicken and even fewer noodles, maybe 3 noodles total.

Do not eat here, even if you're drunk.
I love the prime rib here...drools...so much so I have dreams about it, then I have to drive all the way to Vegas for the AYE deal!

Thought I bragged about this restaurant before.  Guess not.  Everytime we stay at HRH, this is our go to restarurant.  I love the chicken noodle soup, poached eggs w/ corned beef hash, and the Creme Brulee Oatmeal (which is served with golden raisens, milk and brown sugar.  Only thru 11 am each day.)

The service is not spectacular anywhere in this hotel (known fact), but we usually get decent service here and the food is great and quick enough.  The only restaurant open 24 hours at the hotel.

Mr. Lucky's ain't cheap. But with that out of the way I am confident in saying that Mr.Lucky's has the best breakfast in Vegas. Seriously, get the breakfast platter. Or it might have been I was up till the wee hours drunk off my ass. I mean, either way. But still, 24 hours and breakfast all day. And I could swear it tasted great. Service was prompt and our server was nice too. Can't ask for too much more at the wee hours of the morning!

Boooo! Mr Lucky.
I just wanted a bite to eat and you were open.
You tricked me with your friendly smiles and your bright lights showcasing the cooks happily preparing food (24/7). Then you enticed me with your $4.50 Heineken.
Then you tossed me the driest, rudest steak I've ever tasted. Thankfully the salty, dirty au jus, which had been sitting simmering somewhere all day long, was there to soak up some of the dry. But, the fries my friend - no excuse.
Boooo I say, just boooo.
Breakfast is awesome! Great steak and eggs! The bacon, scrambled eggs and pancakes are great too. Everything was perfectly cooked.

We stopped here the eat prior to see Raiding The Rock Vault. There were a lot of customers here because of the Journey show also. We were seated and our order was taken. I had soup and a salad and my friend had a cold sandwich and chips. We waited 50 minutes and my soups was served ( it was cold) and I almost finished that and the waitress came over with another bowl of soup for my friend and she said " start with this, I'll get you food in a bit".  Another 20 minutes went by and she brought my salad. The salad looked as if it was sitting out for a while and I had asked for no dressing just greens and BBQ chicken. The salad was drenched some sort dressing. My friends food showed up a few minutes after and he only ate a half of it. We had tickets to see a show at the Hard Rock at 8:30 and arrived at Mr. Lucky's at 7 pm to have time to eat. The meal, service and food were disappointing. There were several other people there were seated after us who ordered and got there food before we did and ate, paid and left before we were served. We have eaten here several times before without any problems.  Please see second review below. 

On 5/12/17 we were here again to eat before the Journey Concert. Our server was friendly, quick and very attentive. She took our order and the food arrived just as we ordered it. They were full in here due to the concert and being a Friday night. Our service was better than a day or so ago. We never have any issues here at Mr. Lucky's at the Hard Rock so the rating would have to be a 5 star rating as usual. This place is a great place to have a meal or snack. We will be back.

This is the worst of all the Hard Rock Hotel restaurants. I was working at the HRH for five days and ended up eating at almost every establishment there. I was very very very disappointed with Mr. Lucky's.

I went there around 11:30pm, because I needed a quick dinner after getting out of a late night meeting. After the hostess sent me to the counter for a take out order, literally FIVE WAITERS COMPLETELY PASSED ME BY, apparently because I wasn't in their section. I finally had to flag someone down and ask to place an order and they still passed the buck to someone else.

When I finally was able to place an order, I ordered a steak medium rare. It came very well done. IT WAS DISGUSTING. The mashed potatoes accompanying it were also terrible.

I used to think that the off-the-menu "Gambler's Special" was a good deal. (You can look it up with a quick internet search.) However, even that is no longer anything worth trying. You must have a casino player's card, order a drink, and their steak is horrible anyway.

Trust me, NEVER GO TO MR. LUCKY'S!
Food was good I had fish and chips, girlfriend had a roast beef sandwich. Food was prompt and hot. Service was quick and friendly. A little over priced, but you are paying for the atmosphere.

I ate here twice during my stay at Hard Rock hotel. First time I had a burger and it was pretty good, though a bit pricey ($13.99 for the basic and $1 per item). The good thing was that I got blue cheese and it was real and there was a lot of it. The burger it seemed was not freshly ground and was thin, so it cooled quickly.

The second time I got Lucky's club and it was simply enormous ($12.99). To make a dent I had to deconstruct it. The turkey meat was real and not that processed stuff. I got cole slaw on the side and it was delicious, juicy and not too much mayo. 

Overall, the food here is pretty solid and I would return.

Arrived in Vegas around midnight and checked into the Hard Rock hotel. There wasn't many options for food at that time on a Sunday night here. So I  this place out and ordered the Huevos Rancheros. I was very happy with my food. Very good and fast service. Would recommend this diner to anyone. They have a variety of food as well. Burgers, sandwiches, breakfast, appetizers, some seafood,steaks. A little bit of everything.

Being in a casino, you're rarely encouraged to leave.  This is the place you want to eat at odd hours that pretty much has everything. I'm a big fan of all day breakfast, and will order it at all chances if given the opportunity.

Mr. Lucky's is a old school diner in the casino (think johnny rockets, just crappier).  The casino actually has about 5 some odd restaurants, but I think this is the only one open at weird hours.

One thing I always get at breakfast is pouched eggs (cause I like them).  The thing that kinda bugs me about some restaurants is that they steam them into this little perfect briquette of a egg.  This is NOT how to poach an egg...  I mean, how hard is it to boil water with vinegar in it?

I also got the ham.  The piece of ham I got was about 1.5cm thick.  Seriously gigantic in terms of breakfast portions.  Apparently this is where you get ham steaks in vegas at breakfast.

All in all with the price through the roof (it is vegas...) and the mediocre food, I'd probably recommend going somewhere else.  There's a coffee shop that has sandwiches on the other side of the casino.  Go there... end of story.
I have been here 5 times over the past couple years and have only eaten huevos rancheros and I am ok with that. It is the best!!

Great service great food perfect view of all the beautiful women walking around in bikini
Best place ever maybe that's why they call it mr lucky s make sure they give you the booth right next to slot machines
The disco fries were on point
And the prime rib beef dip was Bombay 
Little pricey but worth every cent
Great food  two thumbs up

I am at the Hard Rock quite a bit. This specific night I was actually trying to get into the Pink Taco but they were. Mr. Lucky's has always been a good fall back. The food id good as well as the service. This last time, I asked about the fish and chips and the server made a face, which is honest so I ordered the Salmon.

I had heard of Mr. Lucky's from a close friend of mine who frequents vegas. He told me about Mr. Lucky's  777 deal and that I had to go, and ask for it since it isn't on the menu. Intrigued i made sure to put this place on my list of spots to visit when i was in vegas.

It is located within the Hard Rock hotel. Opening the heavy class doors as you enter you are greeted with the sights, sounds, and smells of Vegas. People gambling, the ringing of the machines and the smell of cigarettes. You walk though the hotel into a "food court" style area with different restaurants and clubs to choose from. 

Mr. Lucky's didn't seem to really shine in the middle of the other places, but we entered anyway. You stand to be seated, which only took a few minutes. The waiter was friendly and quickly got us our drinks and order. All we said was "two 777 deals" he then kinda quietly asked us how we liked out steak and quickly left. Not sure if that was to hide the deal from others or that was his personality. The meal was surprisingly good for only 7 dollars YES 7 dollars for Steak, shrimp,salad and potatoes. The meat was cooked as ordered and was nicely seasoned and tender. The shrimp had a great flavor and was seasoned nicely. The potatoes were almost whipped and had a very smooth texture. I was very satisfied and full after finishing my meal.

This is something you must do while in vegas especially if your on a budget. All that food for only 7 dollars it doesn't get better then that.

Great food, even better people watching. 

We have stayed at the Hard Rock for the last 5-6 years annually while we attend a convention in LV (no, not that one;-)) each January.  We have really come to appreciate and love Mr. Lucky's 24-7.   We eat breakfast there each morning during the show, plus, dinner or a late meal at least two additional times.  Total, were in the restaurant 5-7 times during each convention.  I normally order the same thing each morning which is the egg white Rehab Omelette.  It's fantastic, and really a healthy option when you'll be on your feet all day.  It's full of mushrooms, broccoli, green onion, and tomato, plus a large slice of avocado on top, and either hash browns or fresh fruit and toast on the side.  At dinner time, I have tried almost everything else on the menu. All of which have been delicious.    The real star of Mr. Lucky's 24/7 is the location. Located just off, and open to the main casino, the people watching is 2nd to none in the city.  This is especially true during the "other" convention that is actually being hosted in the hotel.  It's just never boring and we could sit there all night watching.  So much fun.

Staying at the Hard Rock Hotel. When planing your days and nights of debauchery is it a good idea to find the always open eatery. Here we had Mr. Lucky's 24/7.

I ended up grabbing breakfast here to take back to the room. Pretty much your normal breakfast diner food set up. Sticky menus and greasy food are sometimes just what you are looking for. 

I ordered the oatmeal and a stack of pancakes. The oatmeal was fine with a small side of brown sugar. The pancakes were better. Huge stack of 4 that were about the size of the plate. Sweet buttermilk and butter on top hit the spot after waking up to a hungry tummy.  

If I hadn't taken my order to go I would have definitely dined in. The restaurant is spacious and looked nice looking out to there casino for some people watching. Speaking of - name drop alert - David Spade was there eating when I stopped by. Vegas Baby! Ahem anyways the food is good and available. Service was decent and prices didn't gouge me too much for hotel food. Get and use your Backstage Pass players card to save some $$.

This place gets a 3 star because the food was AMAZBALLS and it was the perfect amount. Now as far as the staff.... it was about 9:30 ish and we were seated in the empty restaurant. About 2 mins later someone came by to say they would be with us in a minute...didn't even see who it was because she zoomed by so fast. Well she must was tooooo busy and two other people came to take the drink order and food order...(it looked like a manager and a bus boy) so once the food came out the bus boy came back and refilled our drinks, bought us some silverware and condiments and anything we needed. His name is ABE!! That's it! lol he was perfect! After we got everything we needed and half way thru the meal this random lady walked up and asked if we needed anything else.. so confused I said no. Well needless to say we left the tip to Abe instead of Ashley! They should make him a server!! Thanks so much Abe

I had breakfast and Dinner here and I was actually impressed with the flavor and serving size that they give for the price point. So highly recommended and worth the try. So if you ever in Vegas and you staying at the Hard Rock Hotel. This is a must try. I had the prime rib French dip and it was broke da moufff Ono. Aloha

Drunk off our asses...stumbling across the casino looking for this place.

4 in the morning...starving.

And....what do we see?  Steak and eggs for $4.99!!!!

Awwww yeah....got me at Hellooooooooo FOOD!!!

I can come back here anytime from midnight to noon for this cool ass deal.  I thought the portions would be small or the steak will be nasty....but wow.  It's pretty good damn it.

This place sucks...  although I think the food was good.   Wait how many vodka red bulls did I have?   I'll take the cheeseburger.  Man this place sucks... Is this the Hard Rock cafe or some shitty 24/7 diner that looks like it belongs way off the strip.   Speaking of strip... Wait weren't we just at the Crazy Horse Too?   I remember... VIP room... no wait, yeah sure I'll have another Vodka red bull.   Dude this food sucks but tastes pretty good anyway.   Gotta be drunk to eat this shit...   Never mind, everything else is closed...  right?!?!?!   It's 3:30 am you dumbshit... yeah it's closed!  Whatever happens in Vegas stays in Vegas, right?   Not unless you fucking yelp about it, it don't!!!!

I went to Lucky's in November of 2010 and wasn't really impressed.  The price was good.  However the prime rib that I had look wonderful and the first few bites where then in got very tough and hard to chew.  Again the prices are good for a budget but you really do get what you pay for here.

This 24-hour eatery inside the Hard Rock saved the day when my husband and I arrived tired and late from our tour. We were supposed to fly back home that night at 11 pm after or tour ended, but sadly our flight got delayed by a couple hours. Knowing that the airport restaurants would all be closed at that time, we hopped into Mr. Lucky's for a bite. Firstly, their entire menu is available to order. I really appreciated that as some 24/7 spots sometimes offer a limited "late night" menu only when the foot traffic is slow. Secondly, the food itself was great and the service was phenomenal. My husband and I received the same level of customer service and attention as "day time" guests would. A definite place to visit if you're looking to satisfy some late night cravings.

3.5 stars.

Most come for the $7.77 special for a 6 oz. flat iron steak, skewer of shrimp, salad and mashed potatoes. Others come for the unlimited $9.99 prime rib. I went for the noodle bar which was being advertised outside the restaurant. Too bad the noodle bar is closed on Mondays and Tuesdays... and I was there on Monday. Instead, our FABULOUS waiter Anthony suggested the teriyaki bowl which I had with chicken and the teriyaki sauce on the side. He even went and got me some of the chili sauce they serve through room service. He really made our dinner enjoyable. I had enough leftovers to last for TWO more meals. 

We also had the chicken nachos as an appetizer because one of my friends could not wait until a beer or two in to order/enjoy dinner. Surprisingly they weren't super heavy. I didn't eat much of it but there was still plenty of leftover after three of us attacked it. The queso was really good, the chicken was tender and Anthony brought us the garlic habanero hot sauce (which wasn't so hot but definitely tasty) which topped off each chip nicely.

One of our friends ordered the chocolate cake with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Very rich but SO good. We all had one bite and were happily satisfied. 

We also had the $25 off $35 from restaurant.com which worked out great. For the nachos, $7.77 special, teriyaki bowl, dessert and 3 beers we paid $35 including tip and tax. The portions make it worth it.

The trip I previously made to Mr. Lucky's involved late night eating after throwing back a few drinks. I remember having one of their breakfast specials and MAN, it was amazing.

Great for the morning after breakfast, as t hey have a HUGE menu with almost anything you might desire. The 777 is a must have! steak, shrimp, mashed potatoes and a salad for 7 dollas and 77 cents. Only down fall the wait... I don't understand how the wait was so long considering there were plenty of empty tables! The hostess was no help, as all we wanted was to sit down and order a mimosa or Irish coffee to cure the hangover but instead we had to wait in line until the servers were caught up. Mind you; I waited tables while in college and the crowd was managable, I think the waitress was just a rookie. Other then that if you are staying at the Hard Rock its a must try.

TLDR: 24 hour facility inside Hard Rock Hotel & Casino, Triple 7 special available, but only if you ask for it, inadequate customer service, ok/overpriced food, $1 discount with players' card on most items

After a long night on the town, my friends and I decided to visit Mr. Lucky's 24-7 for some late-night eats to end the debauchery. I regrettably did not order the Gamblers Special which contains steak cooked to your preferred temperature, a skewer of shrimp, mashed potatoes, and seasonal veggies. The 777 special is only available with a Players' Card and is not offered on the menu. Instead, I ordered the veggie burger. If you have the players' card, however, most items di receive a $1 discount.

It is my belief that, within reasonable doubt, the hostess and servers are overworked and underpaid as we were greeted with a forced, robotic greeting, no eye contact and rushed tones. Our server was responsible for multiple tables and we had to flag her down just to get a refill of water and soda. 

With regards to the food, about 60% of the order was accurate. The funny thing was that the orders with special requests were accurate, but the regular orders were incomplete often missing things like lettuce, sauce, or the side of toast. The veggie burger did not taste like Morningstar Farms (thank god) and was actually pretty decent for $13.99...Needless to say, I will not be returning to this location any time soon. The sub-par service matched with overpriced/adequate food encourages me to spend my money elsewhere.

Great food. Good service. Right prices. Okay ambiance.

Sweet cream pancakes=5 stars
Bacon
Eggs over medium had to go back doe to that crust. Eggs with crust? No thanks.
Tri-tip hash/scramble, friend said she could eat again and again.
Good food. Good price.  Located at the Hard Rock Cafe, they have pretty good food items.  I think its open 24/7 so if you ever have the munchies this place is pretty good to try out.

Went in last Saturday night to meet up with some friends, play @ tables, have some drinks, etc......Got hungry later in the night and wanted a bite to eat. Ended up ordering a Burger. Asked for a Bacon Cheeseburger no onion on it. Ended up getting a Cheeseburger, no bacon and onions on it. I was so amazed when I saw the burger I didn't say anything. looked like processed cheese slice melted on and patty did't look even to be a 1/3 pound. Very disappointing for a $13 burger.

Mr. Luckys is located in the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino.  Thank gosh they are open 24-7 because boy did I need this yummy food!!  We came here after an event in the casino so it was packed with people, and even though most of the tables were taken, they still promptly sat me and three others at a table.  Our server took our order and it only took 10 minutes to get our food. I ordered the veggie burger with goat cheese,  IT WAS AMAZING!!!!  The sweet potato fries were hot, crispy and delicious!  I wish I had discovered this place sooner.  Looking forward to going back soon!

If you are staying at the Hard Rock Hotel and too lazy or hung over to go anywhere else, Mr. Lucky is most likely where you will end up.

Don't expect fabulous food, service, or a good deal. You can expect to eventually drink and eat basic dishes at any hour.

Decent food for when you're visiting, or in our case, staying at the Hard Hotel Hotel/Casino. As the name suggests they are open 24/7 and that goes for serving breakfast around the clock too!  We have dined here 2x already more because of convenience. When we found ourselves getting back to the casino very late one night, they were the only ones open so ,for that, we are thankful. 
I have had the veggie omelet with potatoes and wheat toast. Very filling meal. On our second late night visit, I had the veggie burger which was decent but nothing special. Service is kind of hit or miss. 

Also, obviously the restaurant is rock and roll themed so lots of cool memorabilia around the restaurant. There are even tvs playing music videos . Overall, decent and affordable place to eat if you're hungry . It wouldn't be my first choice for places in town but it sure saves the day for late night munchies!

Had dinner last night, it was pretty good. The restaurant wasn't busy but to be honest the service was not the best. My husband waited over 15 minutes for a root beer float. When he asked for it they finally come tell us they ran out of vanilla ice cream. Not a big deal he ordered a shake instead but the fact that 15-20 mins later they never came to tell him. They didn't charge us for the shake but still, you get my point. My prime rib was tasty and horseradish was great! Good amount of food, it is moderate price but you are in Vegas and the portions are pretty big. I would come back to eat again if I didn't have many choices I just didn't care for the menu much.

I want to give this place 5 stars , how ever I don't know exactly what is going on with the quality of workers that are employed. Between Mr. Lucky's and Pink taco my husband and I have had to put up with hostesses with awful dispositions & bartenders that feel like they can't be bothered doing their job. 

(Keep in mind we have been coming to the place & staying at the hard rock for our vacations since 2012)

My husband and I decided to come to Mr. Luckys for breakfast, upon arrival there was no one at the hostess station for atleast 20 minutes because the "gentleman" was gossiping with one of the waiters. When he realized we were stand there waiting to be seated he treated us with silence and a dirty look. When we said good morning and smile at him he didn't even acknowledge it what so ever , not even a smile, he just ask " how many? ".  

Then turned around and said " yea, so I'm sitting you guys at these tables by the casino" mean while the entire restaurant was open wand filled with empty tables. When I expressed to him that my husband and I would like a seat inside the empty restaurant he picked up the menus, looked up at the ceiling , rolled his eyes and sucked his teeth as if I was inconveniencing him. He then walked ahead of us put the menus on the table and walked away from us. I have never experienced such rudeness in a restaurant in my life. 

Our waitress how ever was a complete gem !! So friend , polite and extremely attentive. I wish I knew her name (she was a pretty blonde older woman, I know she has been working there for a long time because I've seen her in 2012 when I first started coming here and every year after that )

When people go on vacation to get away from the bullshit of their real lives at home they don't want to deal with or be served by someone whom acts as if you are a burden to them, or better yet as if they loathe their job.

I have no idea how this place has more than 2-3 stars. I was suprised this place was in such a nice hotel. The service was slow, uninviting and kinda clueless. My order was screwed up and the guy server was just like "Oh" and replaced it.  I had the tomato soup, it was the worst I've ever had and I order tomato soup often. The mac and cheese was just beyond weird and not tasty at all. Everything just seemed cheap and frozen pre made junk.

Went twice in the last 2 days, had the lucky special burger the first time and the gamblers special the second.  Both were pretty good, service was good and the gamblers special had the steak cooked perfectly.   This might be my new go to at night when I'm here. Ill be back for sure.

My margarita pizza was really good! However, I got so full from water; I only ate 2 slices. Good service; my waitress was efficient. She refilled my water consistently. PLUS I really like staying at the HRH :)

Best part - it opens 24/7!

Alecia was our server and she was great. We suggest skipping the guacamole as they no longer make it fresh, comes from a bag and tastes like chemicals. Hamburger was ordered medium-well and arrived just about rare. Alecia did all she could to make it right. I guess the kitchen was having an off night.

$7.77 Steak n Scrimps?

No better deal than this, I mean c'mon guys.....$7.77 for a decent slab a meat n skewered shrimp, mashed spuds and a salad (good green mix) but go for the Caesar salad, tasty greens they are....

Just get in, order, eat n shut up, don't ruin the special with "service" or "ambiance" or "tablecloths", this is a 24/7 grubb joint.

So I finished off a night of Craps here after hitting the hard eight twice, one with $100 on it, you Crappers know the odds....yeahhhhhhh boyyyyy! Did I say you Crappers?

til next time, Steak ya later.....

What a great diner! I love going here because of all the options. No matter what I'm craving they will have it. I'm a breakfast lover at all times of the day so getting chicken and waffles for dinner is awesome :) The counter is great if your eating solo and they have huge booths if you're with a big group. Get the Bloody Mary, its intense.

Oh my, where do I begin? My girlfriend and I came to this establishment because we were staying at the Hard Rock so it seemed like our easiest option for some "quick" breakfast. Boy, were we wrong. First of all, this
Place looks and sounds like an overcrowded cafeteria, and the workers uniforms are extremely unprofessional and it's hard to recognize them throughout the hubbub. Second, it took forever for us to be waited on and when we did it took 20 minutes to get water, let alone a mimosa that was absolutely disgusting. Well when they finally decided to take out order I ordered the Belgian waffle with strawberries and my friend ordered the bagel sandwich. Lets just say we were thoroughly disappointed 45 minutes later when the server brought us our food. My waffle was hard and cold, the 2 strawberries they put on it were sour, and the syrup was ice cold. I flagged down a waiter somehow, told him, ordered something else, and when that came back I felt the need to read reviews immediately. This place is horrible. So thoroughly disappointed. Will not return nor recommend.

Really expensive and not the best service or food. Two basic breakfast orders: eggs, hash browns, and bacon & pancakes and side of bacon, both with coffees. Total was $48.00! All of it was very greasy and bland. The hash browns, and bacon, even the eggs, were swimming in oodles of oil. The waitress never came to see if we wanted more coffee or water, or to see how the meal was. Basically very inattentive despite that it wasn't really busy. Had to ask for check twice.  When I asked a second time for the check I commented that we were in a bit if a rush since had to catch airport shuttle, and she took so long (over 10 minutes), that we missed the shuttle. I realize all this is just the norm for most of Las Vegas casino restaurants, but todays experience it seemed extraordinarily bad.

Flight landed. Got ready. And needed something quick to eat before partying at Body English.

The hostess told us food takes about 20 minutes, so down we sat. And sat. And sat. There was another table that was also waiting for our mysterious server. It wasn't until we asked another server and talked to one of the chefs that our server finally showed up to take our orders. And that was the first and last time we saw him.

Shared potato skins and chicken nachos. The potato skins were dry and unappetizing. The nachos, however, was bomb! BOMB! Huge plate with goodness piled on! The roasted peppers gave the nachos a spicy kick. And the mixture of nacho cheese and melted cheese, guacamole and sour cream made this dish oh-so divine!

Still, the nachos did not make up the lack of service. We were wondering what that other table ordered since we were almost done and they still haven't gotten their food. And surprise surprise. Next thing we saw, a server brought out three plates of salads for that table. OMG.
This place is delicious and has great service! Definetly recommend comming here!

Get the French Dip "Philly Style" with Onion Rings. You will be happy. See pics. Pancakes are good "Cakes & Eggs". Bacon is goood. Breakfast Quesadilla is awesome. 

What's up with these people who have nothing but good things to say about a place, then give it only 3 stars?

Terrible. 
Both orders were screwed up, steak was dry, toppings were forgotten, prices were wrong. Bad service.

Ehh... It wasn't horrible. Customer service really needs an improvement. And this place got demoted on stars because of it.

So we walked up and the three girls at the hostess stand didn't acknowledge us. But all three looked at us. After a minute of them chattering we actually had to say hello. Then we were walked all over the place before we were finally seated. Really it could have been a straight line not zig zag through passing every table. The place was empty except 4 tables. Our server was not friendly. He came up asked what we wanted to drink, I said ice tea extra lemon, my friend got water. When he came back he asked if we were ready. At no time was he nice or polite. 

We ordered he had the chicken parmesan and I had some bbq burger. The food was bland. The bbq burger had an onion ring, bacon, mac n cheese. The bbq sauce covered up any flavor in this this burger. There were gobs of the sauce and it tasted like a bottled sauce. I had bbq everywhere and had to actually flag our server down to get napkins and refills. the other table by us never got their food and walked out. 

I am going to give them another shot on breakfast one day.

I use to frequent Mr. Lucky's more often when I was younger. We always ate there after seeing a show and I remember how awesome the banana splits were! It has been years since I had been there so I decided to take my family there when they came to town. They obviously renovated a bit and it looked like they expanded more seating areas. 

We were not disappointed with the food, everyone enjoyed what they ordered. You MUST get the French toast, it is the best I have ever had! They are covered with crunchy Frosted Flakes super  yummy! The portions for French toast and pancakes were huge so sharing is not a problem.  I could not give them a 5 star because they did not offer a kids menu and the service was slow considering the place was pretty empty when we visited.

I've always liked Mr. Lucky's.  Huge selection, always open, large portions, and low prices.  I've gotten the $7.77 special countless times, and it's always been very filling and tasty.  I've had the ahi tuna sandwich and really enjoy that.  I've had a couple salads and have enjoyed them.  Nachos are delicious.  Fajitas are delicious.  I can't think of one thing I've had here that's not good.  Even the fries are pretty stellar.

I will subtract a point, though... last time I was here, it was right after the Death Cab for Cutie show at the Joint... a sold out show, or close to it.  My roommate Adam and I wanted to try their new off-menu special, $9.99 all-you-can-eat prime rib.  We sat down amongst all the other concert-goers and were told after a long wait for a waiter that they were out of prime rib.  Really?  After a big show at the Joint you're going to be out of prime rib?  There was even a sign out front of the restaurant advertising it.  I wasn't pleased, but we dined there anyway.  Oh well.

This place is so damn good! I ate here literally everyday for my stay at the hard rock. Omg like there food is so good and the people there is so nice. The portions of their food is big but omg like i wish hawaii had this place because i would eat their everyday like foreals. If you haven't tried this place you guys should definitely check it out. They even have good specials too.

We had an unfortunate experience at this location last night, 12-25. After a night of exploring the town,  we came back to our hotel anxious for a bite to eat. This was the only reputable spot open,  so we asked to get a table.  

Though not even half of the tables were full,  The host let us know that the kitchen was backed up,  and his boss had told him not to seat anyone for 45 minutes.  Having worked in restaurants for years,  I understand that long ticket times lead to unhappy tables... While I've never seen anyone turn away tables,  I know this can be a rough spot for a restaurant,  especially if it's under staffed... 

While we were told we couldn't eat on spot because of the kitchen back-up,  we were told that we could place a to-go order which would be out in 25 minutes..  This made no sense since a kitchen backup should affect both dine in and carryout orders. Ticket times for both should be the same. 

Given the circumstances,  we chose to re-evaluate our food choices,  7 minutes later,  with nowhere else to go,  we chose to return to place a carryout order. We returned and noticed the host seating other tables.... The host informed us that they were now able to seat tables. We were confused,  irritated and couldn't help but wonder had this been something personal or just a show of poor restaurant management. 

We were sat,  ordered an omelet and a salad,  neither of which were great and our server wasn't particularly friendly. 

The food was ok, and I have to say it's truly  nice to have a 24/7 place to eat... Unfortunately,  the service,  especially on the part of the host was despicable.

Went here twice for breakfast since it's the only place to get some and that would offer gluten free.  Went with the eggs both days, tried bacon with the first one...they give you two slices whoopee, it's an 11.99 meal.  Hashbrowns, very basic...they were burnt the 2nd time I got that meal.  I went with the breakfast sausage the other time, it was extremely greasy and mushy, it melts in your mouth but not in a good way.  The best part was substituting the toast for fruit.  Just an outrages price for a breakfast for the quality they give you.  I guess it's also good that you'll get your meal in 5 minutes, which can be good or bad.

Well...  we here 5 times in 3 days on our recent trip and my group all agreed it was fantastic.  Great "diner-type" food at reasonable prices AND the service was fast and friendly!!!  Each time we were there this trip, it was busy and each of the servers was as friendly as could be!  Thanks Mr. Lucky's!

Every Vegas hotel needs a 24 hour joint. Mr. Lucky's would be the lucky one for the Hard Rock. It honestly doesn't feel like a diner here. It's super laid back and the decor is very simple. It's a good thing they have rock and roll memorabilia scattered all over the walls and some nice plasmas posted to watch the game. 

We came with the intent to get their $7.77 deal but somehow we ended up with salad, bbq wings and fries. My friends decided to share the chinese chicken salad and fries while I got the bbq wings. The waitress put enough thought into it and split the salad into two bowls to save us from the trouble of splitting it ourselves. We were very impressed! Too bad it didn't live up to their standards. They mentioned the dressing wasn't right for the salad. Definitely one of the worste salads they've ever had.

I was Mrs. Lucky because I was pretty happy with my bbq wings. It comes with celery and carrots so you can get your vegetable servings for the day. The wings were super meaty and the bbq sauce was sweet with a bit of a kick. The waitress mentioned their popular flavor was the "wild than," but I didn't want to take my chances. I'm not down with Tabasco sauce if you know what I'm saying. Overall, it was a solid meal but we weren't entirely over the moon about this place. Come to Mr. Lucky's if you want to grab something cheap and fast.

My group ended up here after unsuccessfully attempting to get steak and eggs from Tuscany. We were staying at the Hard Rock and asked an employee about good places to eat at 4am and he pointed us here. The menu looked pretty good, especially the breakfast items. I was about to order the country fried steak and eggs in an attempt to get somewhat of a fix since our Tuscany trip failed, but thanks to Yelp, I found out about their steak and eggs special! $7.99 when you order a drink. My group and I were really excited so most of us got the steak and eggs but a few were more intrigued by other items on the menu. I got a medium well steak with scrambled eggs and wheat toast. The portions were large! Two slices of toast both cut in half, I feel like that's a lot of bread. The eggs were great, but the steak was so so disappointing. It was so dry, I couldn't even finish it. I ended up wishing I ordered something else. 

TL:DR 3 stars for sad, dry steak.

Mr. Lucky's is Las Vegas' answer to the 24 hour diner.  The relaxed space comes complete with a long counter, loud open kitchen, and trashy waitresses...ours even wore a necklace that said "Cougar" in large script writing.  

Hard Rock Hotel guests make the most of the space for their hangover breakfast woes, late night munchies, and room service deliveries.  However, the food is good enough to warrant the trip from outsiders.

Of course my friend and I fell into the category of those seeking mid-afternoon hangover relief, so we joined the line waiting for a table at the casual American staple.  We were starving, so when the host asked us if we would be willing to take the two remaining seats at the counter, we jumped at the chance.  However, when we walked through the diner, we noticed several available tables.  We had been duped into the counter seats, but we wound up enjoying the kitchen view so it all worked out in the end.

I appropriately ordered the "Rehab" Breakfast, which included 
scrambled egg whites with mushrooms, sauteed spinach, sliced vine-ripened tomatoes, and my choice of toast or English muffin.  My eggs were well-seasoned, and the balanced plate satisfied every inch of my weary palate.  A delicious glass of freshly-squeezed orange juice was also included, which provided the necessary dose of sugar to energize for an afternoon at the pool.  My friend's Smoked Atlantic Salmon plate included a crisply toasted bagel, red onions, capers, sliced tomatoes, and cream cheese.  The salmon slices were perfectly smoked and salted.  

Mr. Lucky's was a great option for affordable Vegas dining around the clock.  The atmosphere was purely diner-centric, but the food surpassed expectations.

Why would you come here and eat anything besides the $7.77 steak special.

That is a rhetorical statement, not a question. 
Apparently you have to have a player's club card, but maybe they don't ask me for one because I've frequented the establishment so much. The steak has always been cooked to my liking, mashed potatoes have varied between buttery, creamy goodness, or delicious chunky bites, and the salad is a nice complement even though I don't even like salad!

To me, this is a 5 star meal for the quality and price. There are 2 stars missing from my rating because every. single. time. I have visited this diner, the service is wack-tastic. Especially the last 2 times when I had the same lifeless, blunt, unpleasant and slow server. Short for no reason (in manner, not height) and just someone I would not want to interact with. I'm pretty sure my demeanor is friendly and respectful at the least so there is no reason to come at me with that rude ish. And WHY does it take 15 minutes to get a check when my food is obviously gone? I hate looking around like I lost my mom at the grocery store (we are actually both short in height so that has happened quite a bit).

It won't hurt to come here for the special, but make sure you are in the mood to not let anyone ruin your experience.

The only good thing about the hard rock hotel is this restaurant. Food is delicious and you won't break the bank. Best pancakes I've ever had in my life. They're delicious. I also had the skillet which was mouth watering. My friend ordered the nachos they're huge and the cheese was spread evenly everywhere not just on the top like most restaurants do it. Also it's 24/7 so very convenient.

Don't expect great service- do expect (for Tourist Las Vegas at least) decent food at a comparatively reasonable price.  While most of the carnivore fare isn't that great, they do serve a decent veggie burger and fries as well as a huge spinach salad for people looking for a hit of B Vitamins without a metric ton of saturated animal fat.

P.S. Skip the booths and go straight to the counter in the back if you're in a hurry. Service is usually much quicker in front of the grill, especially during the drunk rush.

Went here twice. The fish and chips were kinda blah but their fries are super delicious. Burgers are good too. Service was always great but the second time we were there we had Rick as our server and he was down right amazing! Good, inexpensive place for a quick bite. Nothing fancy but you get what you pay for for sure!

Pros: Late night $9.99 "All you can eat" prime rib
Cons: They don't have all you can eat prime rib all the time

Keeping this short and sweet. If you're looking for a late night meal, you can't beat $9.99 all you can eat prime rib.  The prime rib is seasoned well and the portions are pretty generous.

$9.99 all you cant eat prime rib is all you need to know.
Really good food and really great service. The pancakes, eggs/sausage, coffee and parfait were all extremely yummy! Thank you yelp for helping us choose to come here :)

Had our AYCE Prime Rib fix for $9.99 the other night.  It came with side veggies and mash potatoes.  The roast itself was a bit chewy and tough (mid-rare).  My lady and I thought it was bit barbaric halfway through the meal since the quality was controversial, but we did managed to get most of it down.   I mean sh*t, we paid for an AYCE, so we might as well go for seconds too right?

This method of flagging down our server for the next serving was a trial because the timing can be tricky. We're more accustom to buffet style when we're having Prime Rib.  Once you're acknowledged the server would have to put your order in again, and you'll have to wait until your next plate is delivered. 

The waitress put our 2nd order in and was nice enough to bring us a to-go box for our leftovers.  During the drive home we decided it was best to just toss it away.  Something about our food did not settle well with us.  It was not worth the risk to keep it.  Kind of bum because I love Prime Rib and was hoping this would be my new spot for it.  


side notes:
-Your next serving is just the Roast in Au Jus minus the sides.
-The Sour Cream Horseradish Sauce must be requested. 
-Nearest restroom is in the new HRH
-$7.77 Steak and Shrimp special
-$9.99 AYCE Prime Rib (4pm-4am)

Great lrestaurant inside of the Hard Rock Hotel. It's open 24/7 and that is a huge huge huge plus! 
The prices are reasonable and for a small fee they deliver to your room.
Hubby ordered the pancakes and eggs and he enjoyed. I ordered chicken sausage with home fries. The home fries were delicious and the sausage was good. 
The only thing I didn't like was that the orange juice was 5 dollars. Really. Just for one glass.
Way too pricey. 

You can also call ahead to order and they make it fast.

I recommend especially if you're at the hotel. Very convenient

I probably would have enjoyed this restaurant a little more if I were a drunk gambler stumbling in from the Hard Rock Casino after midnight. This place seems to cater to that crowd the most.

The food is okay and the service is polite but neither one are worthy of the prices they charge here. Viva Las Vegas, right? Like I said, the restaurant is open all hours and they offer a full service menu of diner-style food such as burgers, fries, sandwiches, and they serve breakfast 24/7. 

I ordered the Pepper Steak & Fries which is a grilled t-bone with sautéed bell peppers in marinara sauce with French fries on the side. It was alright but not worth the money I paid. For $26, a steak shouldn't taste like it was fried on a hot plate in a trailer park somewhere.

Our server was a friendly, high-energy guy with lots of drive. He re-filled my Coke three times without my asking him to. Me made us feel welcome and stopped by several times to see if we needed anything else. He's too good for this place.

Mr. Lucky's is a loud busy atmosphere too. If you want a quiet dinner, this ain't the place. They have an open kitchen and a wide open view of the casino floor which allows for a lot of people watching if you're into that.

The food here is good and there are many healthy choices. My friend and I stayed at the hard rock casino and ate here one morning. She's allergic to gluten and was really happy to see gluten free items on the menu such as flatbread, pasta, pancakes and waffles. She ordered the gluten free pancakes and confirm and reconfirmed they were gluten free before she started eating. She got sick shortly after breakfast and we weren't able to get lunch. We told the manager the next morning. The manager did everything imaginable to make us feel they take food allergies seriously.

So this place is 24 hr spot in the Hard Rock Hotel. 

We came here for only for breakfast ( only two other spots you can go for breakfast - one is the dunkin donut and then a cafe like place near the paradise tower . this place is the only breakfast sit down kind of place. 

It's near the front casino- it frees open and airy. It was clean and comfortable . Service was pretty good . Food was good for American breakfast food. 

We never had any issues or complaints. 

Corned beef skillet was pretty good here. It's not the can kind- it's the real corned beef. Very hearty and filling. 

Bacon egg and cheese croissant was good.

Friends had Nutella and banana French toast - good! I had some- but I couldn't have just something sweet as my main dish. My other friend had the pancakes and loved it.

The food here is definitely meant for a hangover or sober up cure. Greasy greasy greasy. I ordered the hard rock hotel special.  It comes with 2 eggs (powdered I'm sure) 2 pieces of bacon (tasted like microwaved bacon) 2 slices of toast and hashbrowns (the only thing I really liked) Overall... It was alright. I shared it with my boy. Service was alright too. The server was friendly which was a nice change from the crowd outside.

Stay at HRH for a week & considering I could not cook my own meals in a hotel room Mr Lucky's would have to be my food away from home 

LOVED it, first day we were there we ended up going downstairs to 
Mr 24-7. Ordered a burger for myself & my gf had the french toast plate & don't forget the Mimosa's!! Those were just as good as the food. Hit up this place several times while staying at HR & each time the food was just as good as the last 

The menu is a little pricey but what isn't in Vegas 
I did not know they had a secret menu until I read the other reviews on yelp :( 

I will be sure to hit up Mr Lucky's the next time I'm in Vegas, the staff was cool & prompt considering it was always crowded I don't know if it was due to Tgiving weekend or people just love this place but I know I loved everything about it

Went to Mr Luckys 3x in 29 hours last weekend! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/BCAw9a_kyx2RddRH9tMmKQ#CPfTBp4QhCCb4qH0zj-ohA

This is a chill casino cafe. Open 24-7 Is it the best one? I think not but it gets the job done at 3am, 1pm, or 8am. Very convenient.

Meal #1 
3am Sat. I had me a prime rib french dip . Pretty damn good, the added provolone was perfect and the au jus was not too salty came with fries $14   4****stars
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/BCAw9a_kyx2RddRH9tMmKQ?select=PFSFpAUNnnkEWOK7xpGDDg#ZGGpedpfIQZytPdLFb8Mxg
It was bigger than the pic shows.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/BCAw9a_kyx2RddRH9tMmKQ?select=PFSFpAUNnnkEWOK7xpGDDg#aI12KGJQ0UQn4lNwXN3ZBg

I had to go back to the hotel to fetch my swim trunks for later on so I treated everyone to lunch. 1pm Sat. afternoon
Meal #2 
Mini corn dogs. My 6yo daughter loved them.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/BCAw9a_kyx2RddRH9tMmKQ?select=PFSFpAUNnnkEWOK7xpGDDg#SvQquFEig7bnz0iIJezYgQ
Nachos, Deep Fried Mac & Cheese, Buffalo Chicken Wings, my Son and I split these three.  With the Deep fried M&C and the wings we got our veggies in the nachos as they came with broccoli and chicken. 3***star average (nachos were kind of cold)
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/BCAw9a_kyx2RddRH9tMmKQ?select=PFSFpAUNnnkEWOK7xpGDDg#-sXr7xVDEOrK2jVxXpLhxg
Others had:
Spaghetti & Meatballs 3***star kind of bland sauce
Chinese chicken salad no rating both said they liked it.
Angus burger no rating but said he liked it
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/BCAw9a_kyx2RddRH9tMmKQ?select=PFSFpAUNnnkEWOK7xpGDDg#k0ojIzMlzJGaT7MvY1K9EA
$110 for lunch with the family ....priceless

Had to be up early for a basketball game so with little time to spare back to Mr Lucky's I go 8am Sunday.
Meal #3
This time I ordered huevos rancheros... good pick very flavorful and just the right size. the sauce and cojita cheese went well with the egg and avocado.  3.5*** stars.

Next time its the $7.77 steak n shrimp or the $9.99 AYCE prime rib deals for me.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/BCAw9a_kyx2RddRH9tMmKQ?select=PFSFpAUNnnkEWOK7xpGDDg#6vE7WYKbZh-08oDTqs0lUA
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/BCAw9a_kyx2RddRH9tMmKQ?select=PFSFpAUNnnkEWOK7xpGDDg#oLd6a_s2MkgnrIvfz6HN_w

I think I have a rule for food:  if it's not good even when I'm drunk, it's not good.  In that respect, Mr. Lucky's is a perfect NO.  Do yourself a favor... it's Vegas, so go big or go home.  Treat yourself to a nicer restaurant or grab some Mickey D's.
Solid diner food. The Chicken Fried Steak is "legit". Their version of Loco Moco is "meh", you should pass.

As far as casino cafés go, Mr. Lucky's definitely does the trick. They've basically got your run-of-the-mill casino café menu chock full of fatty meats and french toast. 

What makes Mr Lucky's special though is what's not on the menu. Namely the $7.77 steak & shrimp and the $9.99 All-You-Can-Eat prime rib. Are they amazing? Not at all. But after a day of Vegas drinking they definitely satisfy.

I recommend subbing fries for the mashed potatoes though, those things look...just... take my word for it - fries. At $9.99 the AYCE prime rib doesn't put too much pressure on, because it turns out all the prime rib I can eat is about 3/4 of one. I've failed gluttons all over the world.

I really like Mr. Lucky's. 

The food is good, the service is fair, and as a local.. it's nearby where I live. I find the prices to be fairly reasonable.. and while the service is hit or miss.. I usually sit at the bar up front, by the kitchen line. I feel like it ensures that I get some attention. (though not always right away) 

The thing is, it is @ the Hard Rock Hotel. I like that.. its 24 hours a day..and you have already heard about the $7.77 Steak and Shrimp deal. There is always the $9.99 all you can eat prime rib and salad and potatoes... all you can eat is the Prime Rib part.  I get the rehab breakfast, or seared tuna tacos every time. Go there, don't take it so seriously, do it .. like it.. love it.

My family and I had visited Mr. Lucky's years ago with great memories of the Gambler's special (steak, shrimp, mashed potatoes, and veggies for $7.77) . When we visited recently, we were dismayed to find out that the special is now $9.99, plus you need to buy a beverage (around $2.99). We also had to wait about 15 minutes until our server came, despite there being few customers at the time. Our server was impatient with us when we reacted to the price hike of the special, and didn't give us time to reconsider our order. And to make the dining experience worse, my steak was way overcooked to be medium done, and the mashed potatoes were much too buttery. My family left with unsatisfied stomachs and great disappointment. We will not be returning again.

Warning: I got bad food poisoning after eating here. 

Ordered the buffalo wings which were extremely dry 

Ordered one of the $12.99 milk shakes. It was the salted caramel one. The donut tasted like it had been sitting out for days. Ended up taking it off the top to get to the ice cream because it was not edible. The salty pretzels that are supposed to be hard were soggy and disgusting. The caramel popcorn at the top was stale. Complete waste of money. Definitely not worth it when the food poisoning kicked in later (although it's hard to tell whether it was from the shake or the disgusting wings.)

Would never dine here again

Reliable and consistent and 24 hours. Good turkey burger, nice and juicy. My friend loves the $7.77 steak and shrimp dinner. Super friendly and accommodating staff.  Have been here a few times and am sure to return for many more.

Great food and huge Bloody Mary. I had the avocado toast with some runny eggs. The bread is supposed to be made in house I think, it was delicious. The Bloody Mary was giant, a meal on its own with a mini sausage patty sandwiches between two little waffles and topped with a deviled egg. 
The actual drink was pretty standard flavor. 
The atmosphere is pretty neat too, lots of costumes from famous artists. 
Pro tip: join the Players Club first, they give you some credits and I think you get points for eating there.

I always go here for the Gamblers 777 special (not on menu). Steak, mash or fries, broccoli, shrimp on a stick $7.77. (Need to buy drink and show gaming card)  This is a cool little place inside the hard rock hotel and casino. Lucky's was moderately priced.  The HRC Breakfast, which was sausage, bacon and eggs. Not a bad place late at night!!

Disappointed with the service - seated at a table and promptly brought water. At that point, no server approached us for almost 20 minutes. We advised the server about the long wait and asked that our order be expedited as we had tickets for a show. The order wasn't expedited - wondering if management assigned to many tables to the server at once. Not good - our first and last visit to the restaurant. The food was OK - nothing outstanding.

In Hard Rock, good food but the service was very slow and the server had a 'didn't care' type attitude. The food was pricey for how simple it was. Complained to the manager about how long the food took (about 40 minutes from when we ordered it) and he just said he'd let the kitchen know our comments.

Wouldn't recommend, the only reason I'm giving it a two out of five is the food is good and there's always the possibility that the service was just off that day.
Great bloody Mary. Definitely worth it 100%. Service is good and people are nice. The hash browns are also on point and great huevos rancheros

This place amazed me.  The food was great.  The girl got a club sandwich and she made me taste is because it was the best one she ever had.  I took a bite and tend to agree.  I loved my patty melt.  And the banana milk shake was outstanding.  Great service.  I have to be honest I wouldn't expect a small town like kingman to have good service.  But this young waitress has obviously been trained properly and she cared.  Everything there seemed to be done with care.

The management is the worst. Let me tell you that it starts at the very top with Mr. Marcus O'Brien. After waiting for almost and hour and a half for our order it was still wrong. He had one excuse after another. It's busy the over wasn't working right. Blah blah blah blah blah. I guess you've need to be a VIP to get good service.

I detest the HRH and its patrons, but this restaurant is bad-ASS!  It's just a 24-hour coffee shop, but it has pretty good food for decent prices, and excellent people watching.  The $7.77 steak special is legendary, and rightly so -- a good-sized, decent quality steak, salad, potato and three skewered grilled jumbo shrimp, for a great price (it's not on the menu, but they serve hundreds a day so they will DEFINITELY know what you're talking about).  

Basically, if you want a good cheap-ass steak special in Vegas, it's either this or Ellis Island. Ellis includes a beer instead of the shrimp skewer -- so take your pick. Personally, I prefer the down-n-out clientele of Ellis Island to the poseurs of the Hard Rock...but there is also something to be said for watching heavily Botoxed ex-groupies stumble around drunkenly with their wannabe rockstar abusive thug husbands. Dinner and a show -- it's the great Vegas tradition!

I ate here for breakfast while staying at the Hard Rock for business. I wasn't expecting much for a diner-like place inside a casino, but the food was actually pretty good. There was a long line for a table, but as I was dining alone I managed to sit at the bar pretty quickly. My eggs, hash browns, and toast arrived promptly and were actually very delicious.
777.... that's it, you don't wanna try anything else, best steak ever. Never disappoints you..my favorite late night dinning place
I would rather eat at Dennys!!! This place was not really good. It was just something to eat cause I was hungry. Kinda bland. . .  !!!

This place sucks in the service department! Went to this restaurant when I arrived at the hotel..when I walked up the girl just looked at me didn't say anything just stared at me blankly..so I said hey how's it going, for 3 please - she seated us and still didn't say anything... 

The guy who brought our drinks wasn't our waitress but he didn't bother to say anything either..

The waitress was at our table bare minimum & seemed like anytime we asked for something when she was actually paying attention - like a side of ranch or a refill we were bothering her and she quickly would bring it to the table and rush off, didn't ask if we needed anything else when we did!

The food was simple and good so I came in the next day to give it another chance, thought I would just do to-go since dinning in wasn't all that & I already knew what I wanted - went to the bar area to order, there was 3 waitress behind the bar and I sat for 15 minutes waiting for a waitress to even ask if I wanted something to drink - that didn't even happen & I was giving eye contact like hey! I'm obviously here for a reason... So when one of them finally spoke to me all she said was I'll be right with you and went to assist the table behind me! 

So I was over it by that point and didn't feel like giving them another chance anymore. So I went next door to culinary drop out to hope for a better experience and just get something to eat! - awesome food & awesome service!!!! (5 stars for them) 

I obviously didn't have a very memorable experience here so I don't have any names of these less than mediocre people but you're better off at any of the other restaurants in this hotel!! just fyi
Went with a party of 8, everything we ordered was hard to swallow.  Luckily we were all starving.

Great late night spot. 

Want to eat but still maintain your buzz? They've got a 4 shots for $10 special running all the time. The Conundrum shot was pretty good - it's Kahlua and Bailey's with some whipped cream. Nice for a nightcap, or at least to tide you over for a bit. 

I kept it simple and got a burger, which tasted good enough but by the time it got to me the bottom bun had soggified (I think that's the scientific term...) due to the juices and heat of the burger. I hate that shit. But luckily this was pretty late at night and I may have imbibed a bit, so a freshly-cooked burger is a step up from the kind of crap I normally would shovel down in that situation. 

I need to come back and try their boozed-up shakes, which I hear are awesome.
