I guess my bottom line here is that unless you're desperate you should go anywhere else. Seriously.

I come here because I get a $5 coupon every month.  I'm here for breakfast having a bagel for $7 because everything else is $10-15.  This is probably one of the most expensive "coffee shops" in Vegas.  The food isn't any better, just the location means they can gouge the people staying at the hotel.

5 stars = Waite staff. 
4 stars = food 

Spaghetti & meatball: huge portion - enough for 3. 
Super moist meatball *drools

Salad + seared Ahi - it's a salad - ago was delish but the dressing was super sour and no Bueno !

Sliders: .... I can eat like 20 of these. Grilled onions / super soft burger pattie - super good ... 

Customer service: every waiter/waitress was super sweet & accommodating.

I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel and I came here twice to eat. The service was excellent: they made accommodations for my friend who was diabetic. They serve traditional American cuisine from breakfasts to burgers around the clock, so after you spend a wild night around town, you can relax with some good ol' American comfort food. For a tourist, the prices and sales tax can hit your wallet. This place has an open-format that looks onto the casino floor, so this place isn't the place if you're looking for a quiet place to recover after a long night. One of the best kept secrets is that if you are attending a concert by the nearby Joint music venue, you can get your receipt validated that gives you front of the line access for the often disorganized lines leading into The Joint.

The best price  Gamblers Special - 
Steak Shrimp and Potatoes $7.77
I honestly couldn't expect any better for that price..

This place is a classic rock star's hangout... after a long time of drinking 'til your liver gives out, this is the place at 4 AM where everyone hangs out.

This time I had the old school burger and fries which was ok but the burger needed some seasoning. 

Rock on!

this is a 4 star based soley on PRICE... HAHAHA....
$7.77 for steak and shrimp =)
you're probably spending tons of money clubbing, drinking, gambling already..... this is a very decent meal for under 10 buckz... it's actually AWESOME!!! =) 
i'd try to come here at least once on my trip.. there are other deals like $2.99 steak and eggs at other hotels too.. but hey.... the hotel's not as nice as this one and $7.77 is quite good =) ...

the quality of food itself is alright.... could be better.. but u really cant' complain cause it's $7.77 =P

We didn't get into Vegas until midnight and while that didn't worry me too much so far as finding places to eat, when we arrived to the Hard Rock hotel and Casino was told this was the only open place - I was slightly anxious. SILLY ME!  Must have been the nerves of the double drive time we had to get here because as soon as we slipped into our leather booth, we were comfy, and completely ready for Vegas!

My son was ready for a hearty meal and the spaghetti and meatball (mountainous!) delivered! He chowed down on the meatball and was getting full but slowly worked through the pasta as well. It was just as he hoped. 

I ordered the buffalo chicken wrap and the chicken strips were so crunchy!  The sauce was just as I hoped and the fries crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside!  

Bottom line whether looking for a meal with your family or late-night munchies after clubbing this is the comfort food you want, the flavors you'd expect kicked up a notch for Hard Rock standards! 

We reviewed the hotel as well if you are considering staying. For more ideas of what to do in Vegas with families, check out my blog. 
#makesmewander

This is the spot to go after a rocking concert for late night eats!

Open 24/7 to satisfy that late night after party hunger, or that mid afternoon hangover you are nursing after a night out that you can barely recall. Mr. Lucky's is there to take care of you with a fusion menu of American and Chinese offerings. Even the prices are not too painful considering it's in a casino where most things are overpriced.

After the concert at The Joint last night I was starving so we made the no-brainer decision to hit Mr. Lucky's and glad we did. They serve breakfast all night and I went right for thee "Rehab" Breakfast - healthy style which I appreciated! It included scrambled egg whites with mushrooms, sauteed spinach, sliced vine-ripened tomatoes, lettuce, and a choice of bread or English muffin. The eggs were cooked just right and there was a lot on the plate. Along with whole wheat toast and a huge cup of coffee this hit the spot.

They also have a few late night specials which are not usually on the menu - a "secret" $7.77 steak and eggs that is pretty darn good that I had a few times, and a $9.99 all you can eat prime rib deal which starts at 12 midnight. Who says you can't eat good for cheap in Vegas anymore?

Service is cheery and attentive with some cute waitresses. This place is a scene for late night people watching, and kinda fun especially after a big concert lets out. Sure, it's a glorified diner, but where else can you listen to great rock music while chowing down? Rock on! \m/

First time here, came at 4am and got the steak and eggs special. This place has the best tasting steak and eggs special I've ever had. It's a pretty good size portion for 9.99 (7.99 with a drink). 

Service was fast and friendly, this will be my new favorite late night cafe!

honestly... this is the best thing in the hard rock at 4:30 a.m. after going way too hard at Vanity... the "secret" menu is spectacular. I mean come on. $7.77 steak and shrimp and $9.99 AYCE prime rib?! (like you need more than just one slab?!) 

for a sunday night after partying with the mountain dew tour kids this is the place to go. the waitress we had was super freaking nice! i was a bit shocked, I might have been a bit (a lot) tipsy but she was very nice... 

def gonna go hit up this place again... prob not sober though.

The turkey dish was smell very bad and couldn't eat at all. 
The chicken was acceptable. 
Too much noise and smoke in outside sitting area.
Not much to say, not a bargain.  If I were in the HRH and hungry, I'd swing around the corner and hit Pink Taco.  Better meal, same hotel.

I have been meaning to come here ever since I saw it on The Best Thing I Ever Ate.  After years of being bookmarked in my mind, I finally stumbled in during the wee hours of the night for their gambler's special.

The gambler's special is an unadvertised plate of steak, grilled shrimp, mashed potatoes and veggies for $7.77.  You have to have the Hard Rock Hotel's backstage pass players card and also purchase a beverage in order to get the special, but it's a good deal.

The steak was cooked medium, just as I asked, and it was good enough for a $7 steak.  I really liked the shrimp, they were a good size and seasoned well. The mashed potatoes were creamy and delicious too.

My friends and I enjoyed the food so much that we came back again the next night.  The second time we shared the Fire Roasted Nachos ($13.99) with chicken (+$3) and good thing we shared because it was huge! They were good nachos and the cheese stayed melty which I love.

Mr. Lucky's is open 24/7 so it's very convenient and they have many different specials depending on the day and time.  Make sure to get the players card because you get discounts on most of the food on the menu with it.

Open 24/7 lots to choose from. Everything I ate here was good. Prices are high but it's vegas, you can get a $1 off each item of you have you're backstage pass from the Hard Rock. Service is super slow at night though, nobody sat me and then I sat myself and then nobody came to greet me so I left that time. Breakfast and lunch they're usually on it .

Review is for the $7.77 non-menu Steak & Shrimp Special.  Repeat - it's not on the menu - just ask for it.  We arrived on Sat night at 8:00pm, no wait!  All four of us ordered the $7.77 special and each steak was cooked perfectly and it was a real nice cut of meat!  The shrimp was great too, potatoes also very yummy.  Green salad was lettuce with a couple of cherry tomatoes and croutons, basic but fine.  Service was fast & friendly.  This is a killer deal and we got more quality than we were prepared for when you're only paying $7.77 for steak and shrimp.  Hell, even at Sizzler you'd pay twice that and it would be horrible.  It's open 24/7 in the Hard Rock Hotel.  I'm trying to figure out just why someone wouldn't go?

its $7.77 for steak shrimp and salad. What else can you ask for?
Mashed potatoes taste instant, the salad dressing is goopy and the steak was overcooked... but again... its $7.77. Just eat it.

This is a great cafe with a cool vibe located inside the Hard Rock Hotel.  We came here for breakfast and had some morning Bloodies too. 
The food, service and ambiance are great and we will definitely plan on coming back.

CLEAN! FRIENDLY! GOOD, NON-GREASY BREAKFAST! French Toast could not have been better. Omelettes were huge and cooked perfectly. Our waitress Cindy was very sweet. Overall I really appreciated the clean and new feeling that the atmosphere provides. We will be back tomorrow morning!

The food was good and the service was top notch. Nicki S. was our waitress amd was very pleasant to work with especially considering we arrived after midnight on Friday am which is a horrible shift to cover in a Las Vegas diner with all the drunk and obnoxious people coming out. She did a great job!

Go for the $7.77 special (not on the menu) and you won't be disappointed.  We used to only go to Ellis Island for our cheap steak dinner but this one has it beat.  The steak is a better cut, the shrimp were very fresh and even the salad was very good.  On top of this, our waitress was extremely friendly and patient even at 1AM.

We stayed at HRH for a few days so ended up eating here a few times. I really enjoyed the Turkey Burger! Breakfast is pretty decent, like my husband says, "kind of hard to screw up some eggs!"  The French Toast was yummy and the pancakes were decent too. Service was great, we had one very honest waiter who shared, "that $4.99 Steak and Eggs, you get what you pay for" which swayed our decision NOT to order it and opted for the French Toast instead!

Great late night eats, convenient and good.
Quick breakfast. Had egg whites with a short stack of pancakes. Eggs cooked perfect. Pancakes hit the spot. Service was friendly and quick. For a casino/hotel diner, it was on the money!

My friends wanted to eat here because we were staying at this hotel.  I never want to eat after drinking because I eat a lot.  I didn't order anything that night, but my friends told me to eat their food.  I said no, but still ate like always!
Fries were delish, like usual.  The pancakes were alright.  I'm not a fan though.  My friend got a huge plate of them and didn't even finish it.  What a waste of food.

Mr. Lucky's has a decent hamburger, and a few other items. Steak and Eggs which is a tradition at 24/7 cafes in Las Vegas is no longer on the dinner menu. After ordering, I asked, and the friendly server said I could order it. Valet parking is easy, and free. The casino has a great, open layout. All in all, I would return to Mr. Lucky's.

I ate here with a friend, getting the $9.99 steak and shrimp special, and my friend had a Hard Rock Cafe membership card, taking the sting off some of the order. I don't really eat shrimp, so I gave this to my friend, but the steak was well-prepared, nothing amazing, but definitely good, and that's fine with me. Mashed potatoes were good. Service was very good.

The best place to eat in vegas, drunk, hungover, or sober! They've got everything! There shot platter is amazing for morning hangovers and their food is bomb on drunken nights! The service is amazing all hours and they don't care if you come down in your swimsuit or all dressed  up straight from the club! Come by yourself or with a group of 15, the employees are attentive and wonderful no matter what! I LOVE MR. LUCKY'S!

After 8 hours of driving, we decided to meet my cousin at this 24-hour joint in the wee hours of the morning.  It's not our usual spot for late-night eats, but since I've had good experiences (breakfast) here in the past, why not give them a try again?  

Walking from the parking garage, we were amused passing by and witnessing some inebriated folk, dog-tired folk, and several trick-turning folk (freaks DO come out at night).  SInce it was 3 am, we didn't have to wait in any line upon arrival.

The turkey burger was decent-sized and was served with sprouts and avocado, however I had much better in the taste department.  The turkey lettuce wraps were my favorite....with noticeable lime, ginger, and garlic flavors.  
Service was prompt  MOST of the time.  Prices were pretty average, for a popular casino diner.  

Aside from people-watching, I wouldn't mind coming back to try out their Asian dishes and desserts.

The best deal in all of Las Vegas.  Order the Steak and Shrimp Special.  It's only $7.77, but it's not on the menu.  You have to ask for it.   It comes with a salad, mashed potatoes, a flat iron steak, and skewered shrimp.  Delicious.  The chicken nachos are enough to comfortably feed two big eaters.  I really haven't explored much else on the menu.  How can I pass up the Steak and Shrimp Special.  The ambiance is great too, plus you're right in the center of the Hard Rock Hotel.  People watching opportunities abound.

The specials here are totally worth it. We checked Yelp before coming here and found out about their off-menu $7.77 steak special. We had to order a drink to accompany this steak special and it could be either alcoholic/non-alcoholic. The reason why I gave this place a 3 star is because there were certain things on their menu that was way overpriced. The menu didn't mention any additional costs. We ended up ordering a loaded baked potato that came out to be $7- almost as much as the steak special. If you're watching your wallet than be careful what you order, otherwise it might end up being very costly.
This place was not so bad..nothing extraordinary but food was decent.  Probably would come back, just took a little long for not even being crowded

This place is terrible. The only plus is that it's in the hard rock hotel. I've thrown up their food several times (probably more alcohol than food). The only thing I've had here that's passable is the steak and eggs breakfast.  It sucks because at late night, at those hours its hard to get food unless you want to eat crappy chips from the little sundries shop.  There's a pizza place across the street open real late...but then again you have to walk across the street. 

Knowing me I'll eat here at least 5-10 times a year because I always stay at the Hard Rock.

This restaurant is absolutely terrible. First of all the breakfast prices are $15 and up. That would be fine if the breakfast and the service was actually good. But the food is terrible and the service is atrocious. We waited at least an hour for breakfast on a monday morning when it wasn't busy. When the food finally came to us it was cold. I don't know about you but I can't eat cold food. This was a major disappointment when you are in Vegas, have a hangover and are in need of some serious food. Save yourself the trouble and do not go here.

i hate this place and it's overpriced. staff were ok. but the food was tasteless and just wasn't appetizing. i can't believe it's in a hotel -_- maybe i ordered the wrong thing. but i tried two of my other friends food. so bland and just didn't taste good. i had chicken and waffles. chicken was dry and waffle tasted as if they got it from the frozen section in market.

The lure of the Gambler's Special brought my family to Mr. Lucky's at the Hard Rock Hotel. For $7.77, you get a steak topped with a skewer of shrimp, mashed potatoes, and seasonal veggies. The gambler's special is not on the menu and patrons must have a player's card to redeem this hyped up deal.

GAMBLERS SPECIAL x 3 ($7.77): The epitome of the saying, "you get what you pay for". My mom described the steak as a poor man's steak, and both my husband and my dad complained that there was a lot of of chewy fatty parts in the steak as well. My mom loved the green beans and mashed potatoes, everyone else not so much. My husband said the shrimp was chewy and over-seasoned, probably to mask the poor quality of the shrimp. Most people who rave about the gambler's specials are intoxicated while consuming their meal, so there's that. 2/5 

VEGGIE BURGER ($13.99): A veggie burger made out of lentils and nuts piqued my interest, but the burger ended up being completely boring, taste wise. It had far too few toppings and needed some zing! It definitely could have been spruced up by some greenery or color of any kind. 2/5

SERVICE: All of the food was served room temperature and took 30+ minutes to arrive. It took a while before our waitress came to take our order. She barely checked in on us. Mr. Lucky's was not busy at all, so she just sucked. 1/5

Worth a Return Visit?
Never again. This visit was below mediocre and the menu items basic. My husband argued that they could have gotten better steaks at Denny's.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2016: #3

Items Selected:
Chocolate Peanut Butter Pie Shake
Breakfast Bloody Mary - Served Spicy with Shrimp, Deviled Egg, Bacon + Sausage + Cheese Waffle Slider, Beef Jerky, Celery, Pickle 
Donut Hole Donuts - Cinnamon, Sugar, Nutella
Butterscotch Pecan Pancake Shortstack - Vanilla Butter, Maple Syrup
Home Skillet - Two Sunny Side Eggs, Ham, Sausage, Bacon, Bell Pepper, Onion, Mushroom, Tomato, Fried Potatoes, Melted Cheddar, Sour Cream with Whole Wheat Toast
Cornflake Crusted French Toast - Vanilla Butter, Strawberries, Mascarpone, Maple Syrup
Breakfast Quesadilla - Scrambled Eggs, Aged Cheddar, Pork Sausage, Flour Tortilla, Pico de Gallo, Guacamole, Sour Cream
Barnyard Burger - Double Stacked 8oz. Beef and Turkey Patties, Brown Sugar Bacon, Hollandaise, American Cheese and Arugula on a Pretzel Bun with Fries
Red Velvet Cake - Caramelized Pineapple, Vanilla Bean Ice Cream
Sticky Toffee Pudding - Praline Tuille, Vanilla Bean Ice Crream
Skillet Peach Cobbler - Streusel, Vanilla Bean Ice Cream

Originally visited in December of 2013, an early morning watching late-night revelers return to their rooms offered by a location overlooking the gaming floor at Hard Rock Hotel & Casino, Mr. Lucky's has consistently remained one of the best 24/7 bets for a good meal amongst the Resort based options, a recent look showing plenty of clever innovation in a comfortable setting decorated in the way only the Hard Rock can.

Featuring a collection of Comfort Foods concocted by Hard Rock Executive Chef Marcus O'Brien, and manned by a dedicated team from front of house to the kitchen crew, Mr. Lucky's 24/7 sits Casino-center in a sprawling space that features punk-rockers like The Ramones and Circle Jerks set beneath a soundtrack ranging from Funk to Classic Rock, the menu taking a similarly aggressive yet all-encompassing approach.

Focused largely on the All-Day Breakfast section, a few half-portions requested in order to sample widely without wasting food, the meal got started with a glass of ice water alongside two items certainly not undersized in their proper format, the daily "Pie Shake" seeing a fresh slice of Peanut Butter and Chocolate pureed into a Vanilla Ice Cream base with crust as the garnish - an even more eye-popping embellishment offered by way of The Hard Rock Bloody Mary with a hefty bit of spice tucked beneath a top-heavy skewer complete with Shrimp, Deviled Eggs and a Waffle Slider plus several types of Meat.

Told that the recently reformulated Sweet Cream Pancakes would now be featured with traditional toppings as well as a "Pancake of the Week," suffice it to say that at $11.99 for a Full-stack the fluffy Flapjacks offer a significant deal for those looking to share, even the two-cake Shortstack large enough that most will not put a dent in it despite the current offering of Butterscotch Chips and toasted Pecans being especially delicious even without butter or additional accoutrements.

 Continuing the sweet theme with a fryer-basket of airy Cinnamon-Sugar Donut Holes and a sidecar of Nutella, savories from Mr. Lucky's Breakfast are highlighted by the kitchen sink-style Home Skillet with an assortment of Meats and Vegetables layered amidst skillet Potatoes beneath two Eggs and Melted Cheddar, the Breakfast Quesadilla offering a similar concept well-suited for those wishing to eat something lighter.

Still offering the same delicious French Toast as 32 months prior, a true case of "if it ain't broke, why fix it?" with Mascarpone and Strawberries atop Brioche made crunchy by way of Cornflakes, a taste of one of Mr. Lucky's Specialty Burgers showed a good sear on both Beef and Turkey Patties beneath Bacon, Cheese and Hollandaise, the Pretzel bun standing up admirably to the heft of ingredients, though those looking to not make a mess may still wish to indulge with a fork and knife anyways.

Extending the comfort food concept to desserts, American favorites like Cheesecake and Banana Splits joined by several more plus the aforementioned Shakes and Pies, suffice it to say that Mr. Lucky's does not scale back when it comes to the sweeter part of the morning, afternoon or evening - the wedge of Red Velvet separating dense layers by ribbons of Cream Cheese Frosting while both the steamy Sticky Toffee Pudding and reference standard Cobbler are even stronger offerings with the former not dissimilar to a Bacon-spiked version at 35 Steaks + Martinis and the later perhaps trumping Yardbird for tops in Sin City.

FOUR STARS:  Not fine dining by any stretch, but going the extra mile to be better than it has to be, Mr. Lucky's 24/7 again proves the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino to be an underappreciated property in terms of its dining options, and almost universally a bargain compared to similar Strip-based entities.

My friends and I shared the nachos. Within 25 minutes all 3 of us became nauseous and vomitted. However, we had sandwiches earlier that week from there and they were fine. I will never go back - you could say my second experience left a bad taste in my mouth.

I just can't do it again. I have given this place a million chances based solely on location and I get burned everytime. The worst servers if you can call them that. Everytime you wait terribly long just for a methed our server to throw a dirty cup of water at you. Then 20 mins later my drink order is take 15 more mins for my food order then I am not checked on again. I have to do work and effort to find my server to pay the bill. I wanted to eat desert but didn't have another few hours to waste. Really bad !!!

I love secret menus (Jamba Juice, In-n-Out, Starbucks Fatburger).... and the 777 deal at Mr. Lucky's is hard to beat! For $7.77, you get an 8oz steak, a skewer of shrimps, mashed potatoes and a side salad. It's hard to expect high quality food at this price but this is one of the better deals you'll find in Vegas! Since Mr. Lucky's is open 24/7, it's a popular choice at 4am (read: good people watching). 

Also, the bar area is first-come first-served so it's a good option for small parties when there's a long wait.

$7.77 for STEAK & SHRIMP! (Not on the menu. You have to tell the waiter you want the special. And I don't know why everyone keeps talking about a player's card, because I just asked the waiter for it and he didn't check or anything.) 

Only 1 reason why you should be here, and it's for the Steak & Shrimp Special! Order comes with a small salad, steak, 3 pieces of shrimp, and bomb-diggity mashed potatoes. Like, seriously it's so creamy, buttery, smooth, with small chunks of potatoes mixed in that I want to ask if I can just get a whole tub of this to go. I'm sure they use Paula Deen's recipe, when she cuts off a small piece of butter, puts it to teh side, and adds the left over big end in. 

Not the most amazing steak and shrimp, lets be honest. But for that price it's a steal! Especially considering how you can order this 24/7. 

Mr. Lucky's was super packed when we came during the lunch hour, or maybe it was because it was just a busy weekend in Vegas. Service was a bit slow, but not because of the waiter or anything, it was just so packed busy with people. He was still really nice and attempted to meet our needs.
The food sucked the service sucked the waiter said 3 words to me. The bacon tasted like plastic.

one star for open 24/7.

Bad food, tried a few times and gave chances on different dishes but everything tasted worse than Denny's.

Very slow even when there were only 5 tables. I wanted to order takeout, they pointed me to the kitchen counter area, waited for 4min, no body served me, left.

Service - bad! They don't smile or say "thank you" when I paid or even when I left the restaurant.

If you have other choices, don't pick here!

So happy I found this place!  There's a good reason for the five stars.  Well, actually, plenty of good reasons.  My friends and I had great service, they had a veggie burger, AND, their salads had easily THE best croutons I have ever had in Vegas.  Not your cheap, break-your-teeth croutons I dread with most salads; crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  Oh man.  I am fangirling just remembering.  The veggie burger was also delicious.  (Then again, it's hard to go wrong with veggie burgers, since I've never met one I didn't like.)  Plus, they're open 24/7, and the prices are good for Strip or near the Strip.  I'm sure I'll be back here again.

Ate here twice, with friends. A late dinner (11pm) and a breakfast (9am). In both cases, service was good and the food was not. 

Service was attentive. That's totally the high point. The food more than took away from good service, though. At dinner, my party melt was really overcooked (they asked if I wanted medium, I said yes, it came out cooked like a nuclear fire had worked on it for an hour), and was wildly unappealing. Similarly, my breakfast was overcooked - over easy eggs were nearly deep fried, toast was dry and really terrible. 

Disco fries were good, though. Fries, cheese, bacon, gravy. Those were tasty. 

Overall, pass. So many better options.

Okays heres why i give mr luckys a 5 star review.
There's only 1 thing i get at this joint thats worth every penny

1. you can get a sirloin steak with 3 grilled shrimp, garlic mashed potato and a salad for $7.77 (yes triple seven) 

Vegas has gotten expensive, it's rare that you find a good quality food for a bargain, like old times.

Its not on the menu, you just ask for it as steak and shrimp special.

this is really good quality steak and tasty.

Now there is a prime rib special not on the menu that i have not tried but how much of this can you eat in las vegas.

It's $9.99 all you can eat prime rib also not on the menu, you just got to ask for it.

Every time we are around this area for a concert, or event, the first place we think about is Mr. Lucky's for their $9.99 all you can eat prime rib special. The first cut is always large, served with mashed potatoes, and a side of steamed veggies. The veggies are good enough to ask for seconds, but that is not part of the deal. After the first plate, you will begin to receive slimmer cuts of meat by itself. Truth be told, I am stuffed on the first serving alone, but I usually go for seconds to pretend like I'm getting my moneys worth. 

The rest of the menu is over priced. Some friends will order burgers or corn beef hash, but I can never get myself to do so. Most of the time they seem less than thrilled with their orders which makes me want to veer off less. 

The last time I went, the service was not satisfactory. Our server barely paid attention to us, probably because five out of seven of us ordered the special. Our drinks were not refilled in a timely manner, and everyone else around us looked to be higher priority. There have been times where we have received excellent service, but it seems hit or miss. Still a party of 7 with specials will get the bill to $70. If you provide good service, you will get a $14 tip. That is not something to frown upon.

Came here while staying at he hard rock on a whim. Ordered the disco fries and the luckies signature burger. Fair warning it's a lot of food which I learned the hard way. Our waitress was very nice and very attentive which I appreciated. The disco fries were really good but it was A LOT of cheese so be careful. I really enjoyed them. The signature burger was alright but not my favorite which is disappointing for the price ($17). Overall I enjoyed this restaurant but it is pretty pricey.

I have eaten here several times over the years, but I guess I've never written a review for it. It is a solid no frills place. Other times I've been here I've had the Gambler's Steak and Shrimp Special. It's one of the best Diner deals in Vegas! This time we weren't very hungry, we just needed a little something so we split a Margherita Flatbread.  The Classic combination of Mozzarella, Tomato and Basil on a light,crisp Crust. Our waitress kept our coffee cups full and  was friendly and polite. They have a hidden wheelchair ramp, but the hostess brought us right to it with no problem.

I did it!

After so many years of hearing about the 7-7-7 deal, I finally made it to the other side of Vegas to try it. And you know what? It wasn't half bad. I actually really enjoyed it! 

For $7.77 you get a salad, steak, mashed potatoes and 3 small shrimp.

The salad was well, a salad. The steak was tender. The mash was yummy and the shrimp needed a lot of lemon but was otherwise good.

I have to say I think I will be back for this. Or for any of their other really cheap late night specials.

I was very excited to come back to Vegas and eat here again.. I think its my fave place to get late night food after a concert or fun at the Hard Rock. Ordered the Cheese flatbread pizza and it was delicious.. my friend ordered the cheez-it crusted mac and cheese, also very good. 4 shots for $10 great deal!
And the Nachos are famous try them and share with friends.

I'm a regular in the poker room and usually order from there and they always get the order wrong and the service overall is horrible! The only time I ever got good service was from an heavy set gentleman and a woman named Bridgette. Now I've just learned they have fired her...What a joke

This place is the bomb!

First off they're open 24/7. Second, they serve breakfast. ALL. DAY. Breakfast food whenever I want? YASSS.

The food is awesome as well. I ordered a waffle and it came with a GUITAR printed on it. Is this heaven? 

Tip: Ask for extra whipped cream.

Their pies are dope as well. Try one! My family had the fettuccine alfredo and club sandwich and loved it. They also use fresh jalapeños, none of that pickled nonsense. 

Servers are the sweetest and extremely attentive.

Come here! You'll leave full and extremely satisfied :)

Was dying to try the coveted 777 special that I heard so much about. Steak, shrimp, mashed potatoes, and salad for $7.77?! Heck yeah, I'm so there!

The food was good, the service though...sheesh! It was just straight up awful. Our server was nice enough but he had way too many tables to give good service to anyone. 

Example 1: We got our salads AFTER our meal arrives. Being a former waitress, that has to be the biggest restaurant faux pas that could ever happen. We actually had to tell the person that brought our food (not the server) that we hadn't received our salads yet. 

Example 2: We had to flag several other servers down for drink refills. If you have ever been to Mr. Lucky's and ordered their coffee, you'll know that it comes in these mammoth sized mugs so it takes the average person a REALLY long time to finish a cup. He never came by once to offer refills. 

Example 3: We had to ask another server for our check. We just wanted to get the hell out of there. 

If you've got a whole lotta time and want something cheap and pretty tasty, Mr. Lucky's may just be for you!
Seriously good breakfast. Every single item, on point. Waitress was great. Food came out pretty quickly.

Great for a less expensive option at the Hard Rock...but not the place to come if you are looking for a quality meal.

A coworker and I needed a quick bite to eat and all of the other options seemed too slow and were were on a time crunch. We stopped by here and had definitely come to the right place for a quick meal. It was fast and easy...and not too bad.

I had the French dip - the fries were really thick and kind of soggy but the sandwich was pretty good. We remarked that this place probably wouldn't have tasted so good had we not been travelling all day and had we not been ravenous. 

We had a hard time getting our check toward the end as our service had slowed down some but it served our purpose and we were full.

We come here all the time with our service dog this is one of the friendliest places and they have great food as well they know what's biface now and I would definitely recommend this place for anyone you're cruising through or near the hard rock

We decided to try the gamblers special last night at Mr Lucky's. what a disappointment.
The restaurant had 3 tables with customers when we arrived at 5:30pm
Our server took our order and we were looking forward to our meal. The salad was great, then can the entree. The mashed potatoes looked like a pile of hardened plaster, the shrimp were dry and tasteless, the steak was so tough that the steak knife couldn't cut it. My wife didn't event attempt to eat the meal. I also ordered a glass of house wine. When the bill came I saw that they charged me $11.00 for the wine. what a rip off. I see now why the gamblers special is not on the menu.

Best bloody ever and totally worth the price!! It's lunch and a drink, deliciously amazing breakfast cheeseburger with lots of cheese and lots of bacon and waffle buns, piece of beef jerky, shrimp, deviled egg, pickle, and the traditional olives (I could even be forgetting something I feel like I am?). 
I did not get the Caesar salad but heard it was good as well..

I never had a bad experience here the food is awesome I love the servers and they were very attentive don't forget to ask for the steak and shrimp special always use your back stage pass for points get the trailer park or the local moco both are very large and delicious the portions here are obscene you can split each plate four ways and get more bang for your buck.

We have dined here in the past and the experience has always been a great one. After leaving a sushi place, still starving and having spent a small fortune, it was time for Mr. Lucky's. We knew we would get a good Amount of food for a good price. Away we went and what we got was what we expected. Excellent service!!! Our waiter, I can't remember his name, was just awesome! He was prompt and attentive. The hubby chose country fried steak and got eggs and hash browns. I chose the blueberry pancakes. Yum and wow! The portions are huge for a reasonable price. And the quality of the food is outstanding. So yummy! Everything  cooked perfectly and seasoned well. My pancakes loaded with blueberries and delicious! Oh and my drink, the lifesaver, loaded with alcohol and only $9. I would and hopefully will be back.

While my friends and I had stayed in the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino for 5 days I had  Mr. Lucky's experience twice....

1) Dinner- ehh. not impressed. I got the Mediterranean wrap which stated had a yogurt dressing and hummus. I tasted practically no hummus in the entire sandwich and there was definitely no yogurt dressing. Plus super slow service.

2) Late night- Mr. Lucky's redeemed itself with the Midnight - 8am steak and eggs special. When stumbling in from the strip at 4:30am nothing says cure my hangover like over-easy eggs, hash browns, steak and toast for an awesome price. I woke up the next day feeling fantastic... whether it was the steak and eggs or not i'll never no. But it sure hit the spot! 

Bonus points! When our group of 9 did stumble in at 4:30am at the end of our meal our waitress offered to split our checks up for us. 

However, for a real culinary experience seek elsewhere, but for kids on a college budget I can't complain too much.

I visited Las Vegas for 5 days and a friend coincidentally came in during my visit and staying at the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino.  She recommended us having dinner at Mr. Lucky's 24/7 Cafe because they were reasonably priced and the food was decent.  I had previously read about their $7.77 Steak and Shrimp dinner, so we agreed to have dinner there. 
First of all, the restaurant was near empty and the service sucked.  We were waiting for about 20 minutes before the server even walked over to greet us. She apologized for the delay but it was still uncalled for being the restaurant was near empty.
I didn't find the restaurant to be that reasonably priced at first sight of the menu.  I asked about the $7.77 Steak & Shrimp meal and the server told me that it was that price as long as you ordered a beverage.  I ordered the meal. It was a 6 oz Steak with 3 grilled Shrimps on a skewer, mashed potatoes and string beans.  For the price it was adequate. The taste was good and service size was decent.  I do feel the Steak special at Ellis Island Casino & Brewery (see my review for that) is a better deal for a little bit more $ but this wasn't bad.  
The onion tower was huge but over priced.  The onion rings were very tasty but not worth the price.  The tater tots side order was enough for the entire table and more.  It was priced well. 
I enjoyed my meal, but there are other places around that are much better quality and better service.

Saturday morning around 10a and no wait for a party of eight, which was a nice surprise. Our server was quick to get us all set up and orders in. We ended needing to add four more people and our server was very nice about it. Grabbed another table and some chairs to accommodate us. Our food came out fairly quick. Went with my standard eggs, wheat toast and well done potatoes and everything was perfect. The potatoes were nice and crispy on the outside and perfect texture inside. Coffee was kept refilled the whole time. Prices were reasonable considering everything in Vegas is so expensive now. 

Although I'm giving this place 5 stars, I would only eat here again if I stayed at the Hard Rock, nothing really special to make a trip just to eat here. Overall, good experience.

The date of this review is Thursday, December 21, 2017.

While staying in Las Vegas, my wife and I decided to have a very late dinner at Mr. Lucky's 24-7. We have read the reviews for this restaurant and we wanted to try it. They are open 24 hours.

We arrived at the place around 10:40 p.m. The hostess informed us to get the Player's Card to get discount for their dinner and credit for gambling at the Casino.

My wife and I decided to have Mr. Lucky's famous Gambler's Special. I asked the waiter about this special and he informed that in order to get this special, a drink must also be ordered with the meal. He informed us that the meal consists of a piece of steak, mashed potatoes, and green beans.

The steak was decent size, but not too generous! Both our pieces were tough to chew. Our green beans were undercooked, almost raw, making them also tough to chew. The mashed potatoes were OK, not too great but not bad either. The normal price of the Gambler's Special is $9.99 but you get a $2.00 discount with the Player's Card.

For this night, our experience at Mr. Lucky's 24-7 was a less than average one. If we find ourselves in Las Vegas again, we may give Mr. Lucky's 24-7 another chance.

i have been here many times, they have a great menu and its a perfect spot to have a good hearty breakfast or late night burger.  its a typical diner type of place with a bit of vegas flare.  staff has always been nice and the food generally comes out of the kitchen quickly....

I'm basing my review of breakfast but it was definitely a five-star meal. My entire family ate the king which is 14 banana pancakes, 14 strips of bacon with whip cream and strawberries. We only got about two thirds done but every bite was delicious.

Order:
- Hard Rock Hotel Breakfast
- Sweet Cream Pancakes w/ Blueberries 

Service:
Server Name - Clay
Time - 12:45AM

Experience:
Our server Clay spoke at a very high obnoxious volume, He reminded me of a typical high school coach or an over ripen frat boy. It was very annoying trying to have an exchange.
When we gave our order, he didn't ask any of your basic questions, such as; 1.'What kind of bread would you like for your toast?', or 2.'How would you like your hash browns?'. When I ordered the pancakes, I mentioned WITH BLUEBERRIES. As soon as Clay heard the order, he immediately said 'Got it!!' and walked off.

Our food came out fairly quick, which was nice.
First, the HRH Breakfast plate; I received wheat bread and barely-brown hash browns, 2 yolks w/ 1 popped, and sausage & bacon. Had Clay of asked how I wanted my breakfast, I might have received sourdough toast and well done hash browns. 
Secondly, the Sweet Cream Pancakes w/ Blueberries; I received plain pancakes with 3 pieces of A single 1 strawberry. When I reiterated what I ordered, the rebuttal I received was, "That's not what the ticket said". Server Clay comes back and we send it back.

Throughout our meal, we got checked on twice... TWICE. Clay would repeatedly walk right past our table to speak with a single(1) gentleman sitting at the table right next to us. It became very bothersome for our server to walk past our table with zero regard. I don't want to call it discriminatory, but it very much felt that way.

This was my first time coming to and eating at the Hard Rock, unfortunately it will also be my last.

A standby that almost seems a nostalgic holdover from a bygone time, now that we live in a time when venerable casino coffee shops are being replaced by Denny's, and TGI Friday's. This is old-school without being stale. My meals here tend to be either bar food or breakfast food - and both are done well. Chicken tenders, club sandwiches and potato skins have always been my go-to dishes here - and they've never done me wrong.

I've been here a few times over the years to order the $7.77 gambler's special, which consists of salad, steak, mashed potatoes, and shrimp.  It used to be a good value and a decent meal.  However, I went yesterday and asked for the gambler's special and was informed by the waiter that the deal has changed.  Now you need to have a player's card (one per table) from the Hard Rock to get the $7.77 deal and you must purchase a beverage, which brings the price to over $10 at the very minimum.  If you don't have a player's card or don't want to go get one (signing-up for one is free), the gambler's special is $10 plus the purchase of a beverage, which will bring your total to over $13 at the very minimum.  I was told by our waiter that the policy changed just a short time ago. 

One last thing I'd like to comment on is the quality of the gambler's special itself.  It seems that the quality of the meal has gone down over time.  It's just not as good as it used to be.  I hope this review helps.

Just had their New York Half & Half, the sandwich comes full of pastrami & roast beef on rye.

Good sandwich overall with fries.

Heard they have a good steak too.

I will stop by here again when staying or visiting the Hard Rock Casino.

Tried their $7.77 steak and eggs and it was delicioussssssss!! 
I need to come back to try their $9.99 AYCE prime rib which starts at 12midnight.

Easily one of the best 24/7 diners in town.  I've somehow managed to get the $7.77 special twice in the last month.  What are they putting on the shrimp??  Buttered crack??  So good after guzzling a ton of drinks.

Only reason why this place earned an extra star to make it two stars is .... Convenience.

Mr Lucky's 24/7 sells your typical American breakfast lunch and dinner. The first night we went about 2am we got seated right away and had quick service. Food was so so, my only gripe about my first visit was the cheese fries. Instead of using shredded or even regular cheddar cheese, they used nacho cheese which made the fries really soggy and gross. All the plates we ordered were large in size and had to take to go boxes for our food.


The second time we ate here it was during Rehab. We had called the front desk to ask what the dress code was cause we were just wearing swimsuits. Front desk put us on hold to probably ask someone who knew how to answer the question better and was told that dress code wasn't enforced until 6pm. So that being said we showed up to Mr. Lucky's to only be turned away because we were in swim suits and we were required to wear bottoms. It's one thing to let us know hey sorry there's a dress code and it's actually enforced all day long rather than giving us a dirty look up and down saying "front desk doesn't know anything. It's been the same rule for like...forever."

All effin right beezy! No need for the attitude! So I suggested for her to get in contact with front desk to let them know the rules so that they aren't misinforming hotel guests and yet I got another smug look.


Yet she continued the attitude and was trying to shoo us away when another waitress came up and offered us to order to go. The nasty waitress with the 'tude was pretty snappy when I asked for my cheese fries to have shredded cheese instead of nacho cheese "we always serve it with shredded cheese" and I quickly served her back with "well that's not what we were served last night!"

Anyways besides my rant, everyone else seemed pleasant but like I said Mr. Lucky's is only good because it's convenient and cheaper than the other restaurants Hard Rock Hotel has to offer.

Only place in Vegas that had food that didn't make my stomach go crazy!!! I had breakfast and lunch here. I really enjoyed the French toast! It was fried some kind of way. The waitress remembered to bring me warm syrup, that's a plus. Over all I liked it and it was in the resort we stayed at The Hard Rock!

I came here earlier today for lunch after I walked out of Pink Taco because of poor service.  Here, the service is always fast and friendly!  Earlier today, It took 10 minutes total from walking in to receiving the nachos I ordered.

The downside was that the nachos were very American, which equates to gross for someone who has lived in San Diego for over a decade.  $18 for nachos with steak that did not taste much like steak.  To Lucky's credit, it's huge and will easily feed 2 people.

That said, I come here often and most of the food is good, especially the breakfast me he and the prime rib dinner, which only cost $18 and rivals what I've had at fine dining restaurants. 

I came back here again this evening to have the "boneyard special", which is steak, eggs, hash browns, and toast (I declined this item), which was delicious.  The best part: this entree was only $7.77 if you buy any drink with it.  It was around $9.59 if you buy it without the drink, so you might as well get what is equivalent to a free drink.  Delicious. The downside: this desk is only available from midnight till 6am.

Overall, I recommend this place for breakfast, lunch and dinner.  I would never suggest you go out of your way to eat here if you are not staying at Hard Rock, but this place has excellent service, above average food for a reasonable price, and it's open 24/7!

Tried Mr. Lucky's because we had another restaurant.com certificate.  We were struggling to order food to meet the $35 minimum.  My husband and I both ordered the American Breakfast, his with bacon, mine with the sausage.  He loved his english muffin, and I was pleased they served egg whites and multi grain toast for something healthy to go with my saturated fat.  I would not order the sausage again, as it did not really seemed to be made of pork and had a weird flavor like it was some unidentifiable meat.

We also ordered a chocolate milkshake and it was very very good.  There were thick ribbons of fudge through the shake that gave it great chocolately flavor.   Still doesn't compare to the booze filled shake at BLT, but those were more than double the price.

I would go here again with restaurant.com certificates as the check as under twenty dollars.  However, it is not my first choice for breakfast in town, I would rather go to The Pancake House at Green Valley Ranch as they are better.

If you are in the Hard Rock you certainly have lots of options, so if you want someplace fancy this is not the place.
However, if like me you want something fair priced, and like  a diner which is nice if you have a group, been out partying, or just want some comfort food this will hit the spot! I loved their burger and their SHAKE if you like shakes was amazing! And the food is quick. 

My other half was celebrating his birthday and his cousin ordered a piece of cake, well this one slice may have well just been a big small cake by itself. It was amazing. 

The service was ok, great at getting the food but not as much checking on you but frankly to me the food was good enough that I didn't really care. This place will not disappoint if you are looking for something to hit the spot this definitely will!

Really liked the food, great menu for a diner. Sandwiches starting at $12. But management needs to get their act together with staffing. They should know that at 3 a.m. on a Saturday morning on 4th of July weekend this place is gong to be packed. It took an hour for us to get our food.

This place is the perfect 24/7 food spot. It's all about the $7.77 steak and shrimp special! A great cut of beef, 3 shrimp, mashed potatoes and salad for such a low price. The perfect meal to satiate even the mightiest case of drunken munchies. 
I also came back for the Prime-rib special between 4  PM and 4 AM. For ten bucks you get a cut of prime rib, mashed potatoes and some mixed vegetables. My buddies and I were finished with out plates when our server came by and asked if we were ready for another "round of prime-rib." We all smiled and shrugged it off as we thought he was joking, but it actually turned out to be all you can eat! We couldn't eat another bite of beef but for those who might be interested, all you can eat prime rib for $10 bucks at Mr. Luckys!

Really bad experience. Heavier set Hispanic server helped up around 7:15pm. Forgot my beer. That's not a big deal. But I literally heard someone tell him he forgot my beer and he avoided our table the rest of the night. Then still tried to leave the beer I never received on my bill. Shady for sure!

This review is based solely on the off-menu Gambler's Special. For $7.77 you get a juicy steak, three barbecued shrimp, mashed 'tatoes, and a decent-sized salad. Well worth the money.

Went at lunch on a Friday and were seated immediately. Service was expedient and enjoyable.

Hard Rock Hotel/Casino provides a great, relaxed atmosphere for this small restaurant, and I will definitely be coming back every trip for the Gambler's Special.

Mr. Lucky's is great for breakfast. The pancakes here are delicious and served the way I like them - hot with whipped butter and warm syrup! Their omelettes are good too, I usually order mine with spinach and feta and fresh avocado on the side. I found my favorite server here - Nick, he works the graveyard shift and is friendly and attentive, he won my heart by making sure the coffee was freshly brewed.
Its the Hard Rock Hotel cafe.  You eat here because its convenient.  They charge in accordance of that.

One of my favorite breakfast choices in Vegas! Their custom omelettes are filling and flavorful although cooked in butter. The steel cut oats are actually one of the first things I think to order. Creamy and filling. You can also add fruit or brown sugar to it. The bacon is well cooked and lean for bacon. Worth the visit!!!!
Good service and food will go back next time I'm in las vagas order me and my girl food and it came out in a timely manner

Always great service here! Friendly waiters, good food at decent prices...you get a little more than what you expect on the flavour side :)

I definitely recommend this restaurant, EVERYTHING on the menu is delicious!
Food is kind of pricey for a late night joint in Vegas.

The best French toast in the world......I come here all the time for breakfast when I come to Vegas every year. We had an amazing waiter , he was on point with everything,  if you come here ask for Marvin. If you don't want to wait and want your food fast, sit at the bar. This is a great breakfast place, I'm not a fan of their lunch or dinner, but it is open 24/7. I was able to meet the chef who created the recipe for the amazingly delicious French Toast, if you come to Vegas, visit the Hard Rock Hotel and try the French toast.
Mr luckys is a really nice place to fulfill late night hangovers at the Hard Rock Hotel. The service is really awesome and the manager and staff are really friendly. This place is a Go!

My boyfriend and I came here after a long night of flying from New York and picking up the rental car. Since it was open 24-7 and it was right in our hotel, we figured might as well. I got the grilled cheese sliders and the tofu rice bowl. He got the cheese quesadillas and the pesto pasta. It was okay. The portions are huge. The cheese sliders were enormous. More like cut sandwiches with Texas style bread. It comes with tomato soup which tasted like it came out of the can. The quesadilla was okay, very cheesy but nothing special. The rice bowl was horrible. I couldn't even finish it. Service was good. The waiter was fast and attentive to our needs. Overall...a good place to go if you are drunk at like 4 am or if you are up late with no other options close by.

VEGAS!
The Hard Rock Café has been on many travel channel, food network, and crazy websites telling you to go and ask for the not so secret $7.77 plate. So my group and I came here for a quick meal before we hit the road about 7am. So here are a few tips on this famous special.
* First go get a players card to receive discounted price. (this will get you $5 dollars of play on the same day on certain games but you need to put in $1 to activate)
* Second you need to order a drink (does not have to be alcoholic but always a good choice in Vegas)
* Lastly you are looking at about $12 per person after tax and tip if you stick to the special and soda or coffee at 7am. 
The food was good and my steak was cooked perfectly. The rest of my group loved the shrimp and even the green beans. So I definitely recommend this special even after the extra hoops you have to jump through.

This place has changed! When I first moved here this place was great! Not so much anymore.. Waited 15 mins for our waitress to even come over to us (& it was NOT busy!) we ordered our food & she quickly hurried off.. Waited another 30 mins for our food.. Which when was brought over I had a big pile of guacamole onto of my food when I just explained to her not to put it on ( highly allergic!) .. She laughed and said sucks that it's guacamole & you can't just scrape it off.. 

Food was still amazing, but the service just put a bad taste in my mouth!
I have been coming to this diner for many years and have enjoyed their breakfast each time. I also love how they give Player's Card holders a discount.
Great place to eat while waiting for our room. Four shots for $10! Amazing deal. And great burgers salads and sides to eat!

my boyfriend and i met up with a good friend of mine and his wife to test out the LUCKY 777 special and we were not disappointed! the steak was about 6-7 ounces with 3 shrimps on a skewer and mash potatoes. pretty darn delicious for $7.77, you can't go wrong with the price! even cheaper then fast food.... the item is not on the menu so you have to make sure to say "i'd like to order the LUCKY 777 special" :) they also have a "all you can eat prime rib" special for $9.99. we will definitely be back at the hard rock to try that out!

Pretty cool 24 hour spot. Was right in our hotel. Great waffles but the breakfast bloody Mary was calling my name and I just HAD to get it.

About 12 oz of bloody Mary mix and I swear mostly vodka...really strong (not a problem). There was your traditional olive and shrimp around the rim and a not so traditional skewer of pickle spears, fresh beef jerky (kind of sweet..loved it), bacon sausage and cheese waffle sandwich, and a deviled egg. Oddly...the  flavors all went together really well. Get it! If not to get drunk or feed ur hangover...get it for picture's sake!

Like most restaurants in Las Vegas, Mr. Lucky's was moderately priced.  Fortunately for me, my meal was going to be free, so we didn't worry about price.  I had the HRC Breakfast, which was sausage, bacon and eggs, while Stephen had the Breakfast Quesadilla, and Stephen's mom had the Corned Beef Hash and eggs.

Service was excellent, and our server checked up on us frequently. The portions were more than adequate, and we could have easily shared 2 of the entrees.  Our server even offered to give us "to go" cups for our beverages, which I accepted.  Thumbs up to this place.  I'd come back, even if it weren't comped.

the $7.77 deal made me feel like i struck it big all weekend. 

it's not on the menu, but the gamblers special is the best deal in vegas. a giant steak, shrimp, a scoop of mashed potatoes and a side salad at any hour of the day will keep you fat and happy with plenty of cash left over to waste on other vegas expenses.

Actually, 3.5 stars.  
We ate both dinner and breakfast here during our stay.  
Great selection of breakfast food, a bit lacking for dinner.
Your standard fare: quesadillas, sandwiches, etc.
The breakfast offerings were a wide range.  They even did egg whites and apple sausage if you wanted to eat healthier.  (That would be Jenni from work, not me!)
Service was pretty friendly and the place seemed really clean.
Ate here twice, which is a good sign.

So hard to get an order right. Darn! Food that did come out correctly fell flat of taste. Very cold dining room so bring a sweater. If you don't like cigarette smoke, find a different restaurant. This one is on the casino floor and you will get second hand.

Slow night, yet they somehow managed to provide slow service. Food was prepared in 10 minutes, but our waiter took 30 minutes to serve it (we saw the cook serve it up under the heat lamp, but didn't know for sure whether it was ours until the server brought it to us).  By the time we received our food,  it was cold, rubbery and tasteless.  The breakfast potatoes were oily and chewy.  The eggs were cold and seemed more like room temperature jello than sunny side up eggs.  Even the check took 20 minutes to bring despite the fact that the place was nearly empty and our waiter was not waiting on anyone else. Oh well. Can't win them all in Vegas. On the bright side, our waiter seemed friendly enough when he took our order and when he brought the check.

I love the diner aspect of this place.  This place has some pretty yummy food!  

I ate at this place three separate times during my stay mostly for the convenience. 

Miso Salmon with cucumber salad-this was actually very good!
Potstickers-snack
Lucky 7  deal...it's not on the menu and you have to request it. Pretty decent for $7.77.  Steak, shrimp and potatoes.  I think you get a salad too.  - after Vanity, I'm so freaking hungry meal.

You probably know about the Gambler's Special ($7.77 for a steak and shrimp dinner). Actually I was just there and I'm not 100% sure that I noticed if the price on the check but I THINK it's still $7.77. :-) Anyway, it's cheap! Not on the menu I guess. I didn't even look at the menu because I've had it before and knew what I wanted. Such a bargain and very tasty. The shrimp were fantastic and I don't even love shrimp. The steak was good. Not the greatest ever, but still very good. I ate every bite of this meal.

Got the munchies late night? well Mr.Lucky's has to offer a lot
its cheap, fast, and good food. That is if you get anything off of the specials menu otherwise the food is somewhat pricey for the food where you can go anywhere else on the strip for a better deal.

Always check out the specials that they have to offer when I was in Las Vegas we stayed at the hard rock and I ordered the famous triple 7 special which comes with a steak, potatoes, shrimp for $7.77 and the steak and eggs for $4.99 remember to show your rockstar club membership to get the discounts and to double check your receipts just to sure they get it correct.

Overall next time I'm at the Hard Rock and its 4am going to stop back in for my fix.

This place gets a 5 because they have seriously the best chicken fried steak and eggs.  I've been here 3 times and each time the dish has come out exactly the same.  Crunchy on the outside and juicy and soft on the inside with gravy that is flavorful without being heavy at all.  
It's open 24/7 which is awesome and they serve breakfast ALL day so who cares what time you wake up in Vegas.  I only had to wait once on my visit there but who doesn't have the drunk munchies at 4am, right?
Service is quick and too the point, on each visit water was brought out automatically which I appreciate.  The waiters could be more tactful but for the most part they are friendly and they get what you need.

Sorry, but this joint should be called Mr. UNLucky's. Stopped in late with some friends from out of town. Service was no where to be found. We all sat there looking lonely and tired with a giant touch of pissed. Had the infamous gamblers special. Must be for losers cuz it was so pitiful from taste to presentation. I know......it is only $7.77, but it would look no better for FREE. Don't waste your time or your luck on this joint.

After seeing some of the poor reviews on here we were a little skeptical, but decided to give them a shot anyway. I'm glad we did.

Service was excellent. They came and checked on us constantly (almost annoyingly so) and were on top of everything.

The food seemed fairly priced and I ended up getting the chicken fried steak. What came out was a massive plate of food to include eggs, hashbrowns, toast, and a huge cut of meat deep fried and slathered with gravy. I honestly only ate half of it before I was stuff and felt like I left a huge portion on the plate.

Top notch.

Made an attempt to try the $5.00 steak and eggs at Mr. Lucky's after a wild night of drinking and partying at Vanity, Hard Rock Hotel's nightclub, and here's what they had to say to our party of six, "Sorry, we're out of steak."

That sucked.

We ate here every day! Get the gambler's special- it's not listed! You need the club card and you need to ask for it and order anything other than water, but 7.77 for a steak, side, and green beans can't be beat! Also the prime rib special is a great deal. I'm a bit of a fan for tater tots, can't resist ordering any time I see then grave a menu, and was not disappointed! That's why we went back the second night- great food, great service. At check in there's a coupon book, 10$ off at Mr. Lucky's..can't get any better!
Gambler's Special.  Hell yeah.  5 Star.

Wowwww!! This place was unbelievably AMAZING! The drinks were top notch. The bloody marry that has 2 mini waffles, shrimp, deviled egg, bacon, sausage, beef jerky and .... I'm forgetting something here but it was great. I forgot our servers name but he was hilarious! Our food came out super fast.

We went And it was a little busy for 3am on a Friday night.  BUT the food was good. We shared the Fire Roasted Nachos, and I have to say they were some of the best nachos I have had. We also ordered buffalo wings, I am pretty picky about wings, and these were good as well. Crispy veggie sticks, fun atmosphere.  Our waiter was very nice and in a good mood, very nice guy I wish i remembered his name. Iove a great attitude.
Both items 27 bucks. not bad for good after duh club food.

I LOVE that its 24/7 and decent.I would suggest going after clubs/ bar hopping. I will be returning for late night snacks.
It's horrible!!! Everything is dry and bland. It's very expensive for reheated frozen food they served. I would never go back there again.

4 stars for the value! 

Checked in to the hard rock for a 2 night stay. Decided to eat here to get the players card special. $10 prime rib/ shrimp dinner and $7.77 steak/ shrimp dinner. 

Service was fine, food was good,and what a deal!

I've eaten here a few times recently while I stayed at the Hard Rock, and it was a mixed bag. Late evening both times, the service was really slow in a nearly empty restaurant, and the BLT in particular [with avocado added] was dry, boring, and not worth the money. I regretted ordering it.

Early morning, in a nearly full restaurant, and the service was smiling and faster than I'd imagined it would be. They kept checking back, and the California omelet [three eggs, avocado, tomatoes, artichokes, onion sprouts, goat cheese, minus the quinoa] was amazing. 

Late morning the next day, there was the same full restaurant, same great service, and the Bacon Blue burger [melted blue cheese, applewood bacon, caramelized onions, avocado] was the best I've ever had. I was in heaven, and almost considered staying longer just so I could have it one more time.

I could be wrong, but I got the sense they put their better servers and cooks on during the morning rush. Not sure I'd bother with Mr Lucky's again before 3 am or after 11 am. But in between those times? I'm all there.

I went here twice this weekend while we were staying at the Hard Rock this past weekend. The first time for breakfast the food was alright (Steak n Eggs). But the second time the food was absolutely disgusting. I got some type of skillet breakfast scramble and the eggs were so over cooked they were chewy and gross. The waitress told me that is how I ordered them! At that point, I left it at that and didn't even try to get it fixed.

Came here after the nine inch nails concert, originally wanted pink taco but they closed at 10. At Lucky's I ordered the Reuben sandwich and my boyfriend ordered the chicken fingers for dessert we had the chocolate cake. Everything was pretty decent food for being a 24 hour diner. Service lacked a little bit they didn't even give me the discount for having a players card.

More like 3.5 stars. Ate the $7.77 Gambler's Special that's not on the menu..not once, but twice! Seriously, delicious and satisfying. My friends thought I was a genius because I knew about this little trick. Could not eat it all both times. Steak, jumbo shrimp on a skewer, mashed or baked potato and a salad. The salad was ridiculously big and the ranch was yuummy!

If you order to go..they charge a buck and it's still worth it to eat on the floor of my room. Service wasn't spectacular.

Ate breakfast here one day on our trip and wasn't impressed with the omelette...too much milk and cheese and not a lot of veggies. Go cheaper and get a few eggs and hashbrowns. Perfect before you hit mid-day drinking :)

What a deal! I heart you Gambler's Special!

This was my 2nd visit here after the renovation and menu changes...and hopefully my last!

First off, Vegas is my second home, and my boyfriend LOVES this place, so when we are at the Hard Rock, I indulge him a visit for his off the menu 777 special (which looks ok and he loves, but he will pretty much eat anything). We shared a Vietnamese shrimp roll appetizer on our first time here and I ordered a cheeseburger the 2nd time we ate here.

Shrimp rolls were DRY and tasteless, so you really start hoping that sauce they served with it is gonna work it's magic as a cover up, and then it doesn't! The sauce honestly tasted like a bad culinary version of children's cold medicine: sickeningly sweet, gooey, can't quite name that fake fruit kind of sauce with a rancid vinegar after taste. Didn't go well with the dried out shrimp roll, but then again what does?

The burger was ok, but it was just a burger. Plain patty on a generic roll. The fries they served with it were pretty funny: the potatoes they used for the fries obviously had a lot of black spots and holes in them, because each fry showed the spots. Limp and brown is not appetizing (***That's what she said! Hahaha***)

Waitstaff and hostess: hard to distinguish from ex-cons and North Vegas hookers, but that's just me. 

Anyway, expected way more from this place, considering that they flaunt a new remodel and menu. Will try to direct my hot honey To eat a quick steak dinner elsewhere from now on.  :o)

$7.77 for tasty steak, a few shrimp and a salad is always a win in my book. I've done a few meals here and can't find much to complain about. It may not be the most romantic place on earth, and the beverages are quite expensive, but I'm sure I will return to this establishment when visiting sin city.

Well, don't expect any kind of service.  I ordered three eggs over medium and a coffee black.  Got three eggs over easy and coffee with cream and sugar.  Waitress dropped my food and never saw her again until I went to pay and then I had to flag her down.  So far my experience at the hard rock has been sub par at best.

Decent enough space. 

Food came fast, you'll see why...

I had HRC breakfast, 3 over easy eggs, bacon, hash browns, sausage, toast. Eggs were way undercooked, whites very runny. Hash browns were extremely undercooked, brown on outside, barely cooked on the thick inside. Toast was barely toasted. 

No wonder it came out fast. 

Husband had Greek omelet. Very bland. Barely any feta cheese. 

Kids had strawberry pancakes which means pancakes with some cut strawberries on top. Weren't very tasty. 

Server was nice enough, but obviously overworked as she rushed through everything and the waist for our check was extremely long. 


The prices were high for crappy food and barely any service. Go somewhere else.
Food was decent, menu was pretty good. My eggs Benedict were a little over salted, but the wife LOVED her steak and service  was prompt and friendly. All in all it was a decent breakfast spot.

Staying at the Hard Rock, we tried every place around. Most barely mediocre. Lucky's was GREAT! The prime rib was always cooked right, shrimp very tasty. We loved the staff and even the Hostess (the young girl) was SO nice and got to know my wife and two young girls. We would go back here to eat and HIGHLY suggest this place to everyone. Great food, great staff. Thank you for making our trip more enjoyable

Found this place on yelp and my friends and I took the walk from our hotel next to Bellagio all the way down the street to Hard Rock. I read about the $7.77 special and decided to go with that! The steak was ok, the shrimp was delicious, and it came with a salad so yaay for that. Can't really complain since it's so cheap! A bunch of people in my group ordered the chicken fried steak and oh boy THAT WAS SOOOO GOOOD!!! yum yum. I'd probably get that next time around. Next time we'll probably also go after 4pm so we can try out that AYCE prime rib special!

We have been here a couple of times over the years.
We are not fans of this place at all.
We tried the 7.77 special steak and shrimp, there is no comparison to the steak dinner you get at Ellis Island on Koval. The steak just did not have a good taste at all.
We have had a few other dinners just never enjoyed the food here.
Most likely we won't go back. its just a average place with average food. Nothing out of the extraordinary.

Came here 3 times as I stayed at the Hard Rock for 6 days. It was never really busy but the staff was never really attentive. When we came for breakfast they were out of corned beef for the corned beef hash so I had the steak and eggs. The food was cooked nicely but the steak was poor quality and tough and the potatoes were bland. Next day at lunch I had the spicy chicken sandwich and the chicken was really overcooked and dry. The hints of flavor I got gave the impression that if the chicken was cooked right it would have been a really good sandwich but as it was, it was very dry. They also advertised $2 Thursday pie but when I asked about it the server said they didn't do that promotion anymore. If that is the case, they need to update the specials card. On my last day there I got the not so secret special steak dinner and again the steak was cooked nicely but was tough and had a piece of gristle which I've never been served anywhere and I have eaten in some real dumps. The shrimp and mashed potatoes were great, the green beans were raw and covered in a bad garlic paste. They would get more stars if the prices were more in line with the quality and the staff was nicer. My experience at Mr. Lucky's made me skip the rest of the restaurants in the resort.

All I remember is a HUGE and delicious chicken nacho. There was so much cheese that the waitress actually brought us extra chips to scoop it up. And it was ridiculously cheap. I'll go back sometime and see if other dishes are as good.

Had the Hard Rock Hotel Breakfast.  Had scrambled eggs with sausage. They were aweful. Powdered eggs maybe. Tasted like wet plastic. Sausage was fair. Fruit cup was very good. No way worth $16.00.
.
Love the vibe here! Very 60s dinner feel. I'm always up for a good burger and fries . Had the quesadilla with super speedy service and the staff is always on point.

Crazy to think this is a first review of this. Now Lucky's has been around for years. Is it the top of the heap in food for Vegas, nah. However is it open 24/7 in a city that never sleeps, you bet your ass. It has gone through renovations along with the casino, but is a great late night eatery or a place to grab a bite after you have gambled all your fun money away or better yet treat you friends to a late night meal after you have cleaned up on the casino floor. 

Overall the five star is more for their convince, than the service and food. I always enjoy what I eat, however, the price would dictate a four star rating (its a little crazy to want nearly $15 bucks for a basic 2 eggs, toast, and bacon meal. The late night service is still decent, its a bit slower obviously at 4am with a smaller staff, but its filling and you can order from breakfast to dinner.

Been here many times over the years and have never been so insulted in my life. Sat down at 8pm... 4 ppl ordered within 5-10 min... 2 entree salads, 1 sandwich a side salad and a soup... 45 min later the food came out.. Waiter was very apologetic... Busy kitchen I get it..: Waiter speaks to manager about the bill. Mgr comes back with " I can offer you a complimentary dessert". If I had just won $10k at the table you would have comped my meal... Never again... Good was good waiter was pleasant... Mgt is terrible and treats patrons like we owe them!!!
Inexpensive but you get what you paid for. The veggie burger was bland, dry and tasteless. The country fried steak and eggs was dry. Service was good though.

Been here too many times to redneck count...(fingers and toes for all you Yankees) 

Service is always great, friendly people, attentive to your needs...

Menu is pretty big, but I gotta say my favorite item? Grilled cheese sliders with a cup of tomato soup for dipping...this isn't your smashed, run of the mill, one slice o' cheese grilled cheese sandwich...oh no...there must be 6 or more slices so you get this incredibly gooey melted goodness in every bite...comfort food at its best...

On our last stay we ate here every morning for breakfast. The staff was super friendly and on the spot. Food was amazing. I'm from the South and haven't had biscuits and gravy like that since we moved out west a year ago. We will defiantly be back and will be trying lunch and dinner too.

While I was staying at the HRH Tower, I won a meal voucher at Mr. Lucky's 24-7.

We weren't really planning on using it, but on the last day, we decided to check out their breakfast menu since it seemed like the most convenient option at the time - we had very little time left before we needed to leave for SoCal. 

Since I was attempting to cut my calories and focus on consuming more protein-heavy meals, I ordered the  "Gambler's Special," which included a bowl of salad, an 8oz sirloin steak, three jumbo shrimp, and garlic mashed potatoes for $7.77. For the size of the steak I got and the jumbo shrimp, $7.77 is definitely a steal.

Did it taste good? Was it quality food? I don't know. It was definitely a little on the oily side, but I did appreciate that the shrimp was not overcooked. As far as the steak is concerned, It seemed like your regular USDA Select cut of meat, and was a little on the tough side.

Overall.. my expectations were very low, and appropriately so.

Bed bugs usually leave bite marks in threes, breakfast-lunch-and dinner. Like a bed bug you can leave your bite track at Mr. Lucky's 24-7 at the Hard Rock hotel as it is open around the clock.

Now there are deals that are not on the menu but spread like herpes over yelp reviews, those are the:

$7.77 Steak shrimp deal
$9.99 All you can eat Prime Rib

The second deal, I just found out about and didn't get a chance to order, but my friend and I order the lucky 7 deal and my other friend ordered the club sandwich. 

The lucky seven comes with 3 moderate sized succulent shrimps. The cut of the steak was fair for the price you pay. It is grilled to your preference, for me medium rare is the only way to go. My friend ordered her's medium well. The ice cream scoop of mashed potatoes were unremarkable, a little gravy could have helped. Also there's a salad that also accompanies. Not a bad meal for a baller on a budget!

Granted, every restaurant should have great service. But c'mon, you gotta do some research to find the path of least resistance. So here's the advice on that path for Mr. Lucky's. Use your casino card to get off-the-menu steak and shrimp for 7.77, must order a drink with it. Sit at the counter to get the best service, watch when your food comes up, and get it hot and fresh. Don't be afraid to send it back if not cooked right. The shrimp was delicious tonight, buttery light charred garlic herb outside and moist tenderness inside. I had to send the steak back because it wasn't cooked as specified and a really tough cut of beef. They corrected it quickly and replaced the first 3 shrimp that I already ate, awesome! It was cooked perfectly the second time. Our server, Niki, was pleasant, made good suggestions, and didn't get flustered although she was slammed. Even the green beans were tasty enough to finish off, garlic and butter seared. This place is good but they will tend to understaff it to cut costs. So be smart from the start.

Ended up coming to Mr Lucky's 24-7 (located inside the Hard Rock Hotel) because the restaurant we had originally made dinner reservation was no more.  I did not mind coming here, since I have never heard of them before and will be a new restaurant to try.
